Appendix A Examples

A.1 Different parameterizations of median function

Example A.1 (Median).

In this example, we have a look at the different parameterizations for the function that computes the median of 3333 numbers. To have a 2222-dimensional example, we set x3‚âî0‚âîsubscriptùë•30x_{3}\coloneqq 0italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 3 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚âî 0. Let the polyhedral complex ùí´ùí´\mathcal{P}caligraphic_P be induced by the maximal polyhedra PœÄ={x‚àà‚Ñù2‚à£xœÄ‚Å¢(1)‚â§xœÄ‚Å¢(2)‚â§xœÄ‚Å¢(3)}subscriptùëÉùúãconditional-setùë•superscript‚Ñù2subscriptùë•ùúã1subscriptùë•ùúã2subscriptùë•ùúã3P_{\pi}=\{x\in\mathbb{R}^{2}\mid x_{\pi(1)}\leq x_{\pi(2)}\leq x_{\pi(3)}\}italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÄ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = { italic_x ‚àà blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚à£ italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÄ ( 1 ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â§ italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÄ ( 2 ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â§ italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÄ ( 3 ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } where œÄ:[3]‚Üí[3]:ùúã‚Üídelimited-[]3delimited-[]3\pi\colon[3]\to[3]italic_œÄ : [ 3 ] ‚Üí [ 3 ] is a permutation and f:‚Ñù3‚Üí‚Ñù:ùëì‚Üísuperscript‚Ñù3‚Ñùf\colon\mathbb{R}^{3}\to\mathbb{R}italic_f : blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 3 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Üí blackboard_R be the function given by f|PœÄ‚Å¢(x)=xœÄ‚Å¢(2)evaluated-atùëìsubscriptùëÉùúãùë•subscriptùë•ùúã2f|_{P_{\pi}}(x)=x_{\pi(2)}italic_f | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÄ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x ) = italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÄ ( 2 ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Since ‚Äñe1‚àíe2‚Äñ2=2subscriptnormsubscriptùëí1subscriptùëí222\|e_{1}-e_{2}\|_{2}=\sqrt{2}‚à• italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚à• start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = square-root start_ARG 2 end_ARG and ‚Äñe1‚Äñ2=‚Äñe2‚Äñ2=1subscriptnormsubscriptùëí12subscriptnormsubscriptùëí221\|e_{1}\|_{2}=\|e_{2}\|_{2}=1‚à• italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚à• start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = ‚à• italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚à• start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = 1, it holds that

wf‚Å¢(œÉœÄ,1)={‚àí2xœÄ‚Å¢(1)=x3‚àí1xœÄ‚Å¢(1)‚â†x3 and wf‚Å¢(œÉœÄ,2)={2xœÄ‚Å¢(3)=x31xœÄ‚Å¢(3)‚â†x3.formulae-sequencesubscriptùë§ùëìsubscriptùúéùúã1cases2subscriptùë•ùúã1subscriptùë•31subscriptùë•ùúã1subscriptùë•3 and subscriptùë§ùëìsubscriptùúéùúã2cases2subscriptùë•ùúã3subscriptùë•31subscriptùë•ùúã3subscriptùë•3w_{f}(\sigma_{\pi,1})=\begin{cases}-\sqrt{2}&x_{\pi(1)}=x_{3}\\ -1&x_{\pi(1)}\neq x_{3}\end{cases}\quad\text{ and }\quad w_{f}(\sigma_{\pi,2})% =\begin{cases}\sqrt{2}&x_{\pi(3)}=x_{3}\\ 1&x_{\pi(3)}\neq x_{3}.\end{cases}italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÄ , 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = { start_ROW start_CELL - square-root start_ARG 2 end_ARG end_CELL start_CELL italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÄ ( 1 ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 3 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL - 1 end_CELL start_CELL italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÄ ( 1 ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â† italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 3 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_CELL end_ROW and italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÄ , 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = { start_ROW start_CELL square-root start_ARG 2 end_ARG end_CELL start_CELL italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÄ ( 3 ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 3 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL 1 end_CELL start_CELL italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÄ ( 3 ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â† italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 3 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . end_CELL end_ROW

See Figure 1 for a 2222-dimensional illustration.

A.2 Illustration of Definition 3.12

A.3 Examples for unique minimal decompositions

Example A.2 (Minimal decomposition for hyperplane functions).

Let f:‚Ñùn‚Üí‚Ñù:ùëì‚Üísuperscript‚Ñùùëõ‚Ñùf\colon\mathbb{R}^{n}\to\mathbb{R}italic_f : blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Üí blackboard_R be a hyperplane function given as f‚Å¢(x)=‚àëi‚àà[k]Œªi‚ãÖmax‚Å°{‚ü®x,ai‚ü©+bi,‚ü®x,ci‚ü©+di}ùëìùë•subscriptùëñdelimited-[]ùëò‚ãÖsubscriptùúÜùëñùë•subscriptùëéùëñsubscriptùëèùëñùë•subscriptùëêùëñsubscriptùëëùëñf(x)=\sum_{i\in[k]}\lambda_{i}\cdot\max\{\langle x,a_{i}\rangle+b_{i},\langle x% ,c_{i}\rangle+d_{i}\}italic_f ( italic_x ) = ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i ‚àà [ italic_k ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ãÖ roman_max { ‚ü® italic_x , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ü© + italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ‚ü® italic_x , italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ü© + italic_d start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT }. We can assume without loss of generality that the hyperplanes

Hi={x‚àà‚Ñùn‚à£‚ü®x,ai‚ü©+bi=‚ü®x,ci‚ü©+di}subscriptùêªùëñconditional-setùë•superscript‚Ñùùëõùë•subscriptùëéùëñsubscriptùëèùëñùë•subscriptùëêùëñsubscriptùëëùëñH_{i}=\{x\in\mathbb{R}^{n}\mid\langle x,a_{i}\rangle+b_{i}=\langle x,c_{i}% \rangle+d_{i}\}italic_H start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = { italic_x ‚àà blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚à£ ‚ü® italic_x , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ü© + italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = ‚ü® italic_x , italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ü© + italic_d start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT }

are pairwise distinct, because otherwise we can simply adjust ŒªisubscriptùúÜùëñ\lambda_{i}italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. The polyhedral complex ùí´ùí´\mathcal{P}caligraphic_P induced by the hyperplane arrangement {Hi}i‚àà[k]subscriptsubscriptùêªùëñùëñdelimited-[]ùëò\{H_{i}\}_{i\in[k]}{ italic_H start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i ‚àà [ italic_k ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is compatible with fùëìfitalic_f. The convex functions g,hùëî‚Ñég,hitalic_g , italic_h given by

g‚Å¢(x)=‚àëŒªi‚â•0Œªi‚ãÖmax‚Å°{‚ü®x,ai‚ü©+bi,‚ü®x,ci‚ü©+di}‚Å¢ and ‚Å¢h‚Å¢(x)=‚àëŒªi<0Œªi‚ãÖmax‚Å°{‚ü®x,ai‚ü©+bi,‚ü®x,ci‚ü©+di}ùëîùë•subscriptsubscriptùúÜùëñ0‚ãÖsubscriptùúÜùëñùë•subscriptùëéùëñsubscriptùëèùëñùë•subscriptùëêùëñsubscriptùëëùëñ and ‚Ñéùë•subscriptsubscriptùúÜùëñ0‚ãÖsubscriptùúÜùëñùë•subscriptùëéùëñsubscriptùëèùëñùë•subscriptùëêùëñsubscriptùëëùëñg(x)=\sum_{\lambda_{i}\geq 0}\lambda_{i}\cdot\max\{\langle x,a_{i}\rangle+b_{i% },\langle x,c_{i}\rangle+d_{i}\}\text{ and }h(x)=\sum_{\lambda_{i}<0}\lambda_{% i}\cdot\max\{\langle x,a_{i}\rangle+b_{i},\langle x,c_{i}\rangle+d_{i}\}italic_g ( italic_x ) = ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â• 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ãÖ roman_max { ‚ü® italic_x , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ü© + italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ‚ü® italic_x , italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ü© + italic_d start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } and italic_h ( italic_x ) = ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ãÖ roman_max { ‚ü® italic_x , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ü© + italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ‚ü® italic_x , italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ü© + italic_d start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT }

are the unique minimal decomposition of fùëìfitalic_f since suppùí´‚Å°(g)=suppùí´+‚Å°(f)={œÉ‚ààùí´n‚àí1‚à£œÉ‚äÜ‚ãÉŒªi‚â•0Hi}subscriptsuppùí´ùëîsubscriptsuperscriptsuppùí´ùëìconditional-setùúésuperscriptùí´ùëõ1ùúésubscriptsubscriptùúÜùëñ0subscriptùêªùëñ\operatorname{supp}_{\mathcal{P}}(g)=\operatorname{supp}^{+}_{\mathcal{P}}(f)=% \{\sigma\in\mathcal{P}^{n-1}\mid\sigma\subseteq\bigcup_{\lambda_{i}\geq 0}H_{i}\}roman_supp start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_g ) = roman_supp start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_f ) = { italic_œÉ ‚àà caligraphic_P start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚à£ italic_œÉ ‚äÜ ‚ãÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â• 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_H start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } and suppùí´‚Å°(h)=suppùí´‚àí‚Å°(f)={œÉ‚ààùí´n‚àí1‚à£œÉ‚äÜ‚ãÉŒªi<0Hi}subscriptsuppùí´‚Ñésubscriptsuperscriptsuppùí´ùëìconditional-setùúésuperscriptùí´ùëõ1ùúésubscriptsubscriptùúÜùëñ0subscriptùêªùëñ\operatorname{supp}_{\mathcal{P}}(h)=\operatorname{supp}^{-}_{\mathcal{P}}(f)=% \{\sigma\in\mathcal{P}^{n-1}\mid\sigma\subseteq\bigcup_{\lambda_{i}<0}H_{i}\}roman_supp start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_h ) = roman_supp start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_f ) = { italic_œÉ ‚àà caligraphic_P start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚à£ italic_œÉ ‚äÜ ‚ãÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_H start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT }.

Example A.3 (Minimal decomposition of kùëòkitalic_k-th order statistic).

We construct a polyhedral complex that is compatible with the function f:‚Ñùn‚Üí‚Ñù:ùëì‚Üísuperscript‚Ñùùëõ‚Ñùf\colon\mathbb{R}^{n}\to\mathbb{R}italic_f : blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Üí blackboard_R that outputs the kùëòkitalic_k-th largest entry of x‚àà‚Ñùdùë•superscript‚Ñùùëëx\in\mathbb{R}^{d}italic_x ‚àà blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. For U‚äÜ[n]ùëàdelimited-[]ùëõU\subseteq[n]italic_U ‚äÜ [ italic_n ] with |U|=kùëàùëò|U|=k| italic_U | = italic_k and i‚àà[n]‚àñUùëñdelimited-[]ùëõùëài\in[n]\setminus Uitalic_i ‚àà [ italic_n ] ‚àñ italic_U, let

Pi,U={x‚àà‚Ñùn‚à£xj‚â§xi‚â§x‚Ñì‚Å¢‚àÄ‚Ñì‚ààU,j‚àà[n]‚àñU}.subscriptùëÉùëñùëàconditional-setùë•superscript‚Ñùùëõformulae-sequencesubscriptùë•ùëósubscriptùë•ùëñsubscriptùë•‚Ñìfor-all‚Ñìùëàùëódelimited-[]ùëõùëàP_{i,U}=\{x\in\mathbb{R}^{n}\mid x_{j}\leq x_{i}\leq x_{\ell}\;\forall\ell\in U% ,j\in[n]\setminus U\}.italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i , italic_U end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = { italic_x ‚àà blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚à£ italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â§ italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â§ italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_‚Ñì end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àÄ roman_‚Ñì ‚àà italic_U , italic_j ‚àà [ italic_n ] ‚àñ italic_U } .

All such polyhedra and their faces form a polyhedral complex ùí´ùí´\mathcal{P}caligraphic_P that is compatible with the function f:‚Ñùn‚Üí‚Ñù:ùëì‚Üísuperscript‚Ñùùëõ‚Ñùf\colon\mathbb{R}^{n}\to\mathbb{R}italic_f : blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Üí blackboard_R given by f‚Å¢(Pi,U)=xiùëìsubscriptùëÉùëñùëàsubscriptùë•ùëñf(P_{i,U})=x_{i}italic_f ( italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i , italic_U end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. It is not hard to see that f=g‚àíhùëìùëî‚Ñéf=g-hitalic_f = italic_g - italic_h where g,h‚ààùí±¬Øùí´+ùëî‚Ñésuperscriptsubscript¬Øùí±ùí´g,h\in\overline{\mathcal{V}}_{\mathcal{P}}^{+}italic_g , italic_h ‚àà over¬Ø start_ARG caligraphic_V end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT are convex functions given by

g‚Å¢(x)‚âîmaxI‚äÜ[n]|I|=k‚Å°(‚àëi‚ààIxi)‚Å¢ and ‚Å¢h‚Å¢(x)‚âîmaxI‚äÜ[n]|I|=k‚àí1‚Å°(‚àëi‚ààIxi).‚âîùëîùë•subscriptùêºdelimited-[]ùëõùêºùëòsubscriptùëñùêºsubscriptùë•ùëñ and ‚Ñéùë•‚âîsubscriptùêºdelimited-[]ùëõùêºùëò1subscriptùëñùêºsubscriptùë•ùëñg(x)\coloneqq\max\limits_{\begin{subarray}{c}I\subseteq[n]\\ |I|=k\end{subarray}}\left(\sum_{i\in I}x_{i}\right)\text{ and }h(x)\coloneqq% \max\limits_{\begin{subarray}{c}I\subseteq[n]\\ |I|=k-1\end{subarray}}\left(\sum_{i\in I}x_{i}\right).italic_g ( italic_x ) ‚âî roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_ARG start_ROW start_CELL italic_I ‚äÜ [ italic_n ] end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL | italic_I | = italic_k end_CELL end_ROW end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i ‚àà italic_I end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) and italic_h ( italic_x ) ‚âî roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_ARG start_ROW start_CELL italic_I ‚äÜ [ italic_n ] end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL | italic_I | = italic_k - 1 end_CELL end_ROW end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i ‚àà italic_I end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) .

Moreover, let œÉi,j,U‚âî{x‚àà‚Ñùn‚à£x‚Ñì‚â§xj=xi‚â§xm\sigma_{i,j,U}\coloneqq\{x\in\mathbb{R}^{n}\mid x_{\ell}\leq x_{j}=x_{i}\leq x% _{m}italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i , italic_j , italic_U end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚âî { italic_x ‚àà blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚à£ italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_‚Ñì end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â§ italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â§ italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT for all m‚ààU,‚Ñì‚àà[n]‚àñU}m\in U,\ell\in[n]\setminus U\}italic_m ‚àà italic_U , roman_‚Ñì ‚àà [ italic_n ] ‚àñ italic_U }. Then suppùí´‚Å°(g)=suppùí´+‚Å°(f)={œÉi,j,U‚à£U‚äÜ[n],|U|=k+1}subscriptsuppùí´ùëîsuperscriptsubscriptsuppùí´ùëìconditional-setsubscriptùúéùëñùëóùëàformulae-sequenceùëàdelimited-[]ùëõùëàùëò1\operatorname{supp}_{\mathcal{P}}(g)=\operatorname{supp}_{\mathcal{P}}^{+}(f)=% \{\sigma_{i,j,U}\mid U\subseteq[n],|U|=k+1\}roman_supp start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_g ) = roman_supp start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_f ) = { italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i , italic_j , italic_U end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚à£ italic_U ‚äÜ [ italic_n ] , | italic_U | = italic_k + 1 } and suppùí´‚Å°(h)=suppùí´‚àí‚Å°(f)={œÉi,j,U‚à£U‚äÜ[n],|U|=k}subscriptsuppùí´‚Ñésuperscriptsubscriptsuppùí´ùëìconditional-setsubscriptùúéùëñùëóùëàformulae-sequenceùëàdelimited-[]ùëõùëàùëò\operatorname{supp}_{\mathcal{P}}(h)=\operatorname{supp}_{\mathcal{P}}^{-}(f)=% \{\sigma_{i,j,U}\mid U\subseteq[n],|U|=k\}roman_supp start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_h ) = roman_supp start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_f ) = { italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i , italic_j , italic_U end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚à£ italic_U ‚äÜ [ italic_n ] , | italic_U | = italic_k }. Thus, Proposition 3.15 implies that (g,h)ùëî‚Ñé(g,h)( italic_g , italic_h ) is the unique vertex of every regular polyhedral complex compatible with fùëìfitalic_f.

Appendix B Constructions by Kripfganz & Schulze (1987)

Construction B.1 (Hyperplane extension).

For all convex breakpoints, the local convex functions are extended to global convex functions with breakpoints supported on a single hyperplane, and the function gùëîgitalic_g is defined as the sum of all these functions. To analyze it in our framework, let ùí´ùí´\mathcal{P}caligraphic_P be any polyhedral complex that is compatible with fùëìfitalic_f and let wf‚ààùí≤ùí´subscriptùë§ùëìsubscriptùí≤ùí´w_{f}\in\mathcal{W}_{\mathcal{P}}italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àà caligraphic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT be the weight function corresponding to fùëìfitalic_f. For œÉ‚ààùí´n‚àí1ùúésuperscriptùí´ùëõ1\sigma\in\mathcal{P}^{n-1}italic_œÉ ‚àà caligraphic_P start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, let HœÉsubscriptùêªùúéH_{\sigma}italic_H start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÉ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT be the hyperplane spanned by œÉùúé\sigmaitalic_œÉ and ùíúf+={HœÉ‚à£wf‚Å¢(œÉ)>0}subscriptsuperscriptùíúùëìconditional-setsubscriptùêªùúésubscriptùë§ùëìùúé0\mathcal{A}^{+}_{f}=\{H_{\sigma}\mid w_{f}(\sigma)>0\}caligraphic_A start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = { italic_H start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÉ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚à£ italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_œÉ ) > 0 } be the hyperplane arrangement consisting of the hyperplanes supporting the breakpoints where fùëìfitalic_f is convex. Let ‚Ñãf+subscriptsuperscript‚Ñãùëì\mathcal{H}^{+}_{f}caligraphic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f end_POSTSUBSCRIPT be the common refinement of the polyhedral complex induced by ùíúf+subscriptsuperscriptùíúùëì\mathcal{A}^{+}_{f}caligraphic_A start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and ùí´ùí´\mathcal{P}caligraphic_P. The weight function wg:ùí´n‚àí1‚Üí‚Ñù:subscriptùë§ùëî‚Üísuperscriptùí´ùëõ1‚Ñùw_{g}\colon\mathcal{P}^{n-1}\to\mathbb{R}italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_g end_POSTSUBSCRIPT : caligraphic_P start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Üí blackboard_R given by wg‚Å¢(œÉ)‚âî‚àëœÉ‚äÜHœÉ‚Ä≤,wf‚Å¢(œÉ‚Ä≤)>0wf‚Å¢(œÉ‚Ä≤)‚âîsubscriptùë§ùëîùúésubscriptùúésubscriptùêªsuperscriptùúé‚Ä≤subscriptùë§ùëìsuperscriptùúé‚Ä≤0subscriptùë§ùëìsuperscriptùúé‚Ä≤w_{g}(\sigma)\coloneqq\sum\limits_{\begin{subarray}{c}\sigma\subseteq H_{% \sigma^{\prime}},\\ w_{f}(\sigma^{\prime})>0\end{subarray}}w_{f}(\sigma^{\prime})italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_g end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_œÉ ) ‚âî ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_ARG start_ROW start_CELL italic_œÉ ‚äÜ italic_H start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÉ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_œÉ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) > 0 end_CELL end_ROW end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_œÉ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) is in ùí≤‚Ñãf+subscriptùí≤subscriptsuperscript‚Ñãùëì\mathcal{W}_{\mathcal{H}^{+}_{f}}caligraphic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and nonnegative and hence the corresponding function g‚ààùí±‚Ñãf+ùëîsubscriptùí±subscriptsuperscript‚Ñãùëìg\in\mathcal{V}_{\mathcal{H}^{+}_{f}}italic_g ‚àà caligraphic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is convex. It follows that h‚âîg‚àíf‚âî‚Ñéùëîùëìh\coloneqq g-fitalic_h ‚âî italic_g - italic_f is convex as well, yielding the desired decomposition.

Construction B.2 (Local Maxima Decomposition).

Let {P1,‚Ä¶,Pm}=ùí´nsubscriptùëÉ1‚Ä¶subscriptùëÉùëösuperscriptùí´ùëõ\{P_{1},\ldots,P_{m}\}=\mathcal{P}^{n}{ italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ‚Ä¶ , italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } = caligraphic_P start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and fisubscriptùëìùëñf_{i}italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT be the unique linear extension of f|Pievaluated-atùëìsubscriptùëÉùëñf|_{P_{i}}italic_f | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Moreover, let Mi‚âî{j‚àà[m]‚à£fi(x)‚â•fj(x)M_{i}\coloneqq\{j\in[m]\mid f_{i}(x)\geq f_{j}(x)italic_M start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚âî { italic_j ‚àà [ italic_m ] ‚à£ italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x ) ‚â• italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x ) for all x‚ààPi}x\in P_{i}\}italic_x ‚àà italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } and gi‚âîmaxj‚ààMi‚Å°Pj‚âîsubscriptùëîùëñsubscriptùëósubscriptùëÄùëñsubscriptùëÉùëóg_{i}\coloneqq\max_{j\in M_{i}}P_{j}italic_g start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚âî roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j ‚àà italic_M start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Then

f=mini‚àà[m]‚Å°maxj‚ààMi‚Å°fi=mini‚àà[m]‚Å°giùëìsubscriptùëñdelimited-[]ùëösubscriptùëósubscriptùëÄùëñsubscriptùëìùëñsubscriptùëñdelimited-[]ùëösubscriptùëîùëñf=\min_{i\in[m]}\max_{j\in M_{i}}f_{i}=\min_{i\in[m]}g_{i}italic_f = roman_min start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i ‚àà [ italic_m ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j ‚àà italic_M start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = roman_min start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i ‚àà [ italic_m ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_g start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT

and g‚âî‚àëi‚àà[m]gi‚âîùëîsubscriptùëñdelimited-[]ùëösubscriptùëîùëñg\coloneqq\sum_{i\in[m]}g_{i}italic_g ‚âî ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i ‚àà [ italic_m ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_g start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is a convex function. Furthermore, let hi‚âîg‚àígi‚âîsubscript‚Ñéùëñùëîsubscriptùëîùëñh_{i}\coloneqq g-g_{i}italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚âî italic_g - italic_g start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, then h‚âîmaxi‚àà[m]‚Å°hi‚âî‚Ñésubscriptùëñdelimited-[]ùëösubscript‚Ñéùëñh\coloneqq\max_{i\in[m]}h_{i}italic_h ‚âî roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i ‚àà [ italic_m ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is a convex function as well and it holds that

g‚àíh=g‚àímaxi‚àà[m]‚Å°(g‚àígi)=g‚àí(g‚àímini‚àà[m]‚Å°gi)=g‚àí(g‚àíf)=fùëî‚Ñéùëîsubscriptùëñdelimited-[]ùëöùëîsubscriptùëîùëñùëîùëîsubscriptùëñdelimited-[]ùëösubscriptùëîùëñùëîùëîùëìùëìg-h=g-\max_{i\in[m]}(g-g_{i})=g-(g-\min_{i\in[m]}g_{i})=g-(g-f)=fitalic_g - italic_h = italic_g - roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i ‚àà [ italic_m ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_g - italic_g start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = italic_g - ( italic_g - roman_min start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i ‚àà [ italic_m ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_g start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = italic_g - ( italic_g - italic_f ) = italic_f

Let Hi,j‚âî{x‚àà‚Ñùn‚à£fi‚Å¢(x)=fj‚Å¢(x)}‚âîsubscriptùêªùëñùëóconditional-setùë•superscript‚Ñùùëõsubscriptùëìùëñùë•subscriptùëìùëóùë•H_{i,j}\coloneqq\{x\in\mathbb{R}^{n}\mid f_{i}(x)=f_{j}(x)\}italic_H start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i , italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚âî { italic_x ‚àà blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚à£ italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x ) = italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x ) } and ùíúf={Hi,j‚à£i‚â†j}subscriptùíúùëìconditional-setsubscriptùêªùëñùëóùëñùëó\mathcal{A}_{f}=\{H_{i,j}\mid i\neq j\}caligraphic_A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = { italic_H start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i , italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚à£ italic_i ‚â† italic_j }. Furthermore, let ‚Ñãfsubscript‚Ñãùëì\mathcal{H}_{f}caligraphic_H start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f end_POSTSUBSCRIPT be the polyhedral complex induced by the hyperplane arrangement ùíúfsubscriptùíúùëì\mathcal{A}_{f}caligraphic_A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Then we have that g,h‚ààùí±‚Ñãfùëî‚Ñésubscriptùí±subscript‚Ñãùëìg,h\in\mathcal{V}_{\mathcal{H}_{f}}italic_g , italic_h ‚àà caligraphic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_H start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT.

Proposition B.3.

There is a CPWL function fùëìfitalic_f and convex CPWL functions g,hùëî‚Ñég,hitalic_g , italic_h with f=g‚àíhùëìùëî‚Ñéf=g-hitalic_f = italic_g - italic_h such that every decomposition (g‚Ä≤,h‚Ä≤)‚ààùíü‚Ñãf‚Å¢(f)superscriptùëî‚Ä≤superscript‚Ñé‚Ä≤subscriptùíüsubscript‚Ñãùëìùëì(g^{\prime},h^{\prime})\in\mathcal{D}_{\mathcal{H}_{f}}(f)( italic_g start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_h start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ‚àà caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_H start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_f ) as well as every decomposition (g‚Ä≤,h‚Ä≤)‚ààùíü‚Ñãf+‚Å¢(f)superscriptùëî‚Ä≤superscript‚Ñé‚Ä≤subscriptùíüsubscriptsuperscript‚Ñãùëìùëì(g^{\prime},h^{\prime})\in\mathcal{D}_{\mathcal{H}^{+}_{f}}(f)( italic_g start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_h start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ‚àà caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_f ) is dominated by (g,h)ùëî‚Ñé(g,h)( italic_g , italic_h ).

Proof.

Let ùí´ùí´\mathcal{P}caligraphic_P be the polyhedral complex in ‚Ñù2superscript‚Ñù2\mathbb{R}^{2}blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT with rays œÅ1=cone‚Å°((1,0))subscriptùúå1cone10\rho_{1}=\operatorname{cone}((1,0))italic_œÅ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = roman_cone ( ( 1 , 0 ) ), œÅ2=cone‚Å°((0,1))subscriptùúå2cone01\rho_{2}=\operatorname{cone}((0,1))italic_œÅ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = roman_cone ( ( 0 , 1 ) ), œÅ3=cone‚Å°((1,2))subscriptùúå3cone12\rho_{3}=\operatorname{cone}((1,2))italic_œÅ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 3 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = roman_cone ( ( 1 , 2 ) ) and œÅ4=cone‚Å°((2,1))subscriptùúå4cone21\rho_{4}=\operatorname{cone}((2,1))italic_œÅ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 4 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = roman_cone ( ( 2 , 1 ) ). Let wf‚Å¢(œÅ1)=wf‚Å¢(œÅ2)=1subscriptùë§ùëìsubscriptùúå1subscriptùë§ùëìsubscriptùúå21w_{f}(\rho_{1})=w_{f}(\rho_{2})=1italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_œÅ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_œÅ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = 1 and wf‚Å¢(œÅ3)=wf‚Å¢(œÅ4)=53subscriptùë§ùëìsubscriptùúå3subscriptùë§ùëìsubscriptùúå453w_{f}(\rho_{3})=w_{f}(\rho_{4})=\frac{\sqrt{5}}{3}italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_œÅ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 3 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_œÅ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 4 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = divide start_ARG square-root start_ARG 5 end_ARG end_ARG start_ARG 3 end_ARG. Then according to Theorem C.1 the unique minimal decomposition is given by the complex obtained by adding the ray œÅ5=cone‚Å°((‚àí1,‚àí1))subscriptùúå5cone11\rho_{5}=\operatorname{cone}((-1,-1))italic_œÅ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 5 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = roman_cone ( ( - 1 , - 1 ) ) and the weight function

wg‚Å¢(œÅ)={wf‚Å¢(œÅ)œÅ‚ààsuppùí´+‚Å°(f)0œÅ‚ààsuppùí´‚àí‚Å°(f)2œÅ=œÅ5subscriptùë§ùëîùúåcasessubscriptùë§ùëìùúåùúåsuperscriptsubscriptsuppùí´ùëì0ùúåsuperscriptsubscriptsuppùí´ùëì2ùúåsubscriptùúå5w_{g}(\rho)=\begin{cases}w_{f}(\rho)&\rho\in\operatorname{supp}_{\mathcal{P}}^% {+}(f)\\ 0&\rho\in\operatorname{supp}_{\mathcal{P}}^{-}(f)\\ \sqrt{2}&\rho=\rho_{5}\end{cases}italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_g end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_œÅ ) = { start_ROW start_CELL italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_œÅ ) end_CELL start_CELL italic_œÅ ‚àà roman_supp start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_f ) end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL 0 end_CELL start_CELL italic_œÅ ‚àà roman_supp start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_f ) end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL square-root start_ARG 2 end_ARG end_CELL start_CELL italic_œÅ = italic_œÅ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 5 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_CELL end_ROW

as well as wh=wg‚àíwfsubscriptùë§‚Ñésubscriptùë§ùëîsubscriptùë§ùëìw_{h}=w_{g}-w_{f}italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_h end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_g end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Nevertheless, the ray œÅ5subscriptùúå5\rho_{5}italic_œÅ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 5 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is not contained in (the support of) ‚Ñãfsubscript‚Ñãùëì\mathcal{H}_{f}caligraphic_H start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and hence this solution is not in ùíü‚Ñãf‚Å¢(f)subscriptùíüsubscript‚Ñãùëìùëì\mathcal{D}_{\mathcal{H}_{f}}(f)caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_H start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_f ). Since (g,h)ùëî‚Ñé(g,h)( italic_g , italic_h ) is the unique (up to adding a linear function) minimal decomposition, it follows that any solution in ùíü‚Ñãf‚Å¢(f)subscriptùíüsubscript‚Ñãùëìùëì\mathcal{D}_{\mathcal{H}_{f}}(f)caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_H start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_f ) must be dominated by (g,h)ùëî‚Ñé(g,h)( italic_g , italic_h ). Since ‚Ñãf+subscriptsuperscript‚Ñãùëì\mathcal{H}^{+}_{f}caligraphic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is a coarsening of ‚Ñãfsubscript‚Ñãùëì\mathcal{H}_{f}caligraphic_H start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, it holds that every decomposition in ùíü‚Ñãf+‚Å¢(f)subscriptùíüsubscriptsuperscript‚Ñãùëìùëì\mathcal{D}_{\mathcal{H}^{+}_{f}}(f)caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_f ) is contained in ùíü‚Ñãf‚Å¢(f)subscriptùíüsubscript‚Ñãùëìùëì\mathcal{D}_{\mathcal{H}_{f}}(f)caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_H start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_f ) as well, impyling the result for ùíü‚Ñãf+‚Å¢(f)subscriptùíüsubscriptsuperscript‚Ñãùëìùëì\mathcal{D}_{\mathcal{H}^{+}_{f}}(f)caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_f ). ‚àé

B.1 Examples of existing decompositions

Example B.4 (hyperplane extension of kùëòkitalic_k-th order statistic).

Let fùëìfitalic_f be the function from Example A.3. For any i,j‚àà[n]ùëñùëódelimited-[]ùëõi,j\in[n]italic_i , italic_j ‚àà [ italic_n ] and U‚äÜ[n]ùëàdelimited-[]ùëõU\subseteq[n]italic_U ‚äÜ [ italic_n ] with i,j‚ààUùëñùëóùëài,j\in Uitalic_i , italic_j ‚àà italic_U and |U|=k+1ùëàùëò1|U|=k+1| italic_U | = italic_k + 1 it holds that œÉi,j,U‚ààsupp+‚Å°(f)subscriptùúéùëñùëóùëàsuperscriptsuppùëì\sigma_{i,j,U}\in\operatorname{supp}^{+}(f)italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i , italic_j , italic_U end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àà roman_supp start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_f ) and HœÉi,j,U={x‚àà‚Ñùn‚à£xi=xj}subscriptùêªsubscriptùúéùëñùëóùëàconditional-setùë•superscript‚Ñùùëõsubscriptùë•ùëñsubscriptùë•ùëóH_{\sigma_{i,j,U}}=\{x\in\mathbb{R}^{n}\mid x_{i}=x_{j}\}italic_H start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i , italic_j , italic_U end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = { italic_x ‚àà blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚à£ italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT }. Hence, ùí´gsubscriptùí´ùëî\mathcal{P}_{g}caligraphic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_g end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is the braid fan and it holds that g‚Å¢(x)=(nk‚àí1)‚Å¢‚àëi‚â†jmax‚Å°{xi,xj}ùëîùë•binomialùëõùëò1subscriptùëñùëósubscriptùë•ùëñsubscriptùë•ùëóg(x)=\binom{n}{k-1}\sum_{i\neq j}\max\{x_{i},x_{j}\}italic_g ( italic_x ) = ( FRACOP start_ARG italic_n end_ARG start_ARG italic_k - 1 end_ARG ) ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i ‚â† italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_max { italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT }. Thus, the unique vertex (g‚àó,h‚àó)superscriptùëîsuperscript‚Ñé(g^{*},h^{*})( italic_g start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àó end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_h start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àó end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) from Example A.3 is clearly a non-trivial coarsening of the decomposition obtained from the hyperplane extension (since g‚àósuperscriptùëîg^{*}italic_g start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àó end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is a non-trivial coarsening of gùëîgitalic_g) and hence the decomposition cannot be a vertex of ùíüùí¨‚Å¢(f)subscriptùíüùí¨ùëì\mathcal{D}_{\mathcal{Q}}(f)caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_Q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_f ) for any regular polyhedral complex ùí¨ùí¨\mathcal{Q}caligraphic_Q.

Example B.5 (local maxima decomposition of kùëòkitalic_k-th order statistic).

Let fùëìfitalic_f be the function from Example A.3. Then, for U‚äÜ[n]ùëàdelimited-[]ùëõU\subseteq[n]italic_U ‚äÜ [ italic_n ] with |U|=k‚àí1ùëàùëò1|U|=k-1| italic_U | = italic_k - 1 and i‚àà[n]‚àñUùëñdelimited-[]ùëõùëài\in[n]\setminus Uitalic_i ‚àà [ italic_n ] ‚àñ italic_U, we have that gi,U‚Å¢(x)=maxj‚àà[n]‚àñU‚Å°xjsubscriptùëîùëñùëàùë•subscriptùëódelimited-[]ùëõùëàsubscriptùë•ùëóg_{i,U}(x)=\max\limits_{j\in[n]\setminus U}x_{j}italic_g start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i , italic_U end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x ) = roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j ‚àà [ italic_n ] ‚àñ italic_U end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Thus,

g‚Å¢(x)=‚àëi,Ugi,U‚Å¢(x)=(n‚àík+1)‚ãÖ‚àëS‚äÜ[n]|S|=n‚àík+1maxj‚ààS‚Å°xj.ùëîùë•subscriptùëñùëàsubscriptùëîùëñùëàùë•‚ãÖùëõùëò1subscriptùëÜdelimited-[]ùëõùëÜùëõùëò1subscriptùëóùëÜsubscriptùë•ùëóg(x)=\sum_{i,U}g_{i,U}(x)=(n-k+1)\cdot\sum\limits_{\begin{subarray}{c}S% \subseteq[n]\\ |S|=n-k+1\end{subarray}}\max_{j\in S}x_{j}.italic_g ( italic_x ) = ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i , italic_U end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_g start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i , italic_U end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x ) = ( italic_n - italic_k + 1 ) ‚ãÖ ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_ARG start_ROW start_CELL italic_S ‚äÜ [ italic_n ] end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL | italic_S | = italic_n - italic_k + 1 end_CELL end_ROW end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j ‚àà italic_S end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT .

Note that gùëîgitalic_g has only breakpoints when two coordinates that are the two highest coordinates in some set SùëÜSitalic_S swap places in the ordering. So, for any T‚äÜ[n]ùëádelimited-[]ùëõT\subseteq[n]italic_T ‚äÜ [ italic_n ] such that |T|=n‚àíkùëáùëõùëò|T|=n-k| italic_T | = italic_n - italic_k and any bijection œÄ:[k]‚Üí[n]‚àñT:ùúã‚Üídelimited-[]ùëòdelimited-[]ùëõùëá\pi\colon[k]\to[n]\setminus Titalic_œÄ : [ italic_k ] ‚Üí [ italic_n ] ‚àñ italic_T, let

PT,œÄ‚âî{x‚àà‚Ñùn‚à£xj‚â§xœÄ‚Å¢(1)‚â§‚Ä¶‚â§xœÄ‚Å¢(k+1),j‚ààT}.‚âîsubscriptùëÉùëáùúãconditional-setùë•superscript‚Ñùùëõformulae-sequencesubscriptùë•ùëósubscriptùë•ùúã1‚Ä¶subscriptùë•ùúãùëò1ùëóùëáP_{T,\pi}\coloneqq\{x\in\mathbb{R}^{n}\mid x_{j}\leq x_{\pi(1)}\leq\ldots\leq x% _{\pi(k+1)},j\in T\}.italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T , italic_œÄ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚âî { italic_x ‚àà blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚à£ italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â§ italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÄ ( 1 ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â§ ‚Ä¶ ‚â§ italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÄ ( italic_k + 1 ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_j ‚àà italic_T } .

It follows that the set of full-dimensional cones ùí´gnsubscriptsuperscriptùí´ùëõùëî\mathcal{P}^{n}_{g}caligraphic_P start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_g end_POSTSUBSCRIPT of the unique coarsest polyhedral complex ùí´gsubscriptùí´ùëî\mathcal{P}_{g}caligraphic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_g end_POSTSUBSCRIPT compatible with gùëîgitalic_g is given as ùí´gn={PœÄ,T}œÄ,Tsuperscriptsubscriptùí´ùëîùëõsubscriptsubscriptùëÉùúãùëáùúãùëá\mathcal{P}_{g}^{n}=\{P_{\pi,T}\}_{\pi,T}caligraphic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_g end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = { italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÄ , italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÄ , italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Again, the unique vertex (g‚àó,h‚àó)superscriptùëîsuperscript‚Ñé(g^{*},h^{*})( italic_g start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àó end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_h start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àó end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) from Example A.3 is clearly a non-trivial coarsening of the decomposition obtained from the lattice representation and hence the decomposition cannot be a vertex of ùíüùí¨‚Å¢(f)subscriptùíüùí¨ùëì\mathcal{D}_{\mathcal{Q}}(f)caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_Q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_f ) for any regular polyhedral complex ùí¨ùí¨\mathcal{Q}caligraphic_Q.

Appendix C Counterexample to a construction of Tran & Wang (2024)

C.1 Duality and Newton polytopes

In this section we describe the duality between convex piecewiese linear functions and Newton polytopes, adapted to our setup.

A positively homogenous convex CPWL function is a function fùëìfitalic_f such that f‚Å¢(0)=0ùëì00f(0)=0italic_f ( 0 ) = 0, and ùí´fsubscriptùí´ùëì\mathcal{P}_{f}caligraphic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is a polyhedral fan. In this case, it can be written as f‚Å¢(x)=maxi‚àà[k]‚Å°‚ü®x,vi‚ü©ùëìùë•subscriptùëñdelimited-[]ùëòùë•subscriptùë£ùëñf(x)=\max_{i\in[k]}\langle x,v_{i}\rangleitalic_f ( italic_x ) = roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i ‚àà [ italic_k ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ü® italic_x , italic_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ü©, where vi‚àà‚Ñùnsubscriptùë£ùëñsuperscript‚Ñùùëõv_{i}\in\mathbb{R}^{n}italic_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àà blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. We define the Newton polytope of fùëìfitalic_f as the convex hull Newt‚Å°(f)=conv‚Å°(v1,‚Ä¶,vk)Newtùëìconvsubscriptùë£1‚Ä¶subscriptùë£ùëò\operatorname{Newt}(f)=\operatorname{conv}(v_{1},\dots,v_{k})roman_Newt ( italic_f ) = roman_conv ( italic_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ‚Ä¶ , italic_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ). Then fùëìfitalic_f is the support function of Newt‚Å°(f)Newtùëì\operatorname{Newt}(f)roman_Newt ( italic_f ), i.e., f‚Å¢(x)=maxp‚ààNewt‚Å°(f)‚Å°‚ü®p,x‚ü©ùëìùë•subscriptùëùNewtùëìùëùùë•f(x)=\max_{p\in\operatorname{Newt}(f)}\langle p,x\rangleitalic_f ( italic_x ) = roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p ‚àà roman_Newt ( italic_f ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ü® italic_p , italic_x ‚ü©. We now give an interpretation of ùí´fsubscriptùí´ùëì\mathcal{P}_{f}caligraphic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and wfsubscriptùë§ùëìw_{f}italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f end_POSTSUBSCRIPT in terms of the Newton polytope.

Given any nùëõnitalic_n-dimensional polytope P‚äÇ‚ÑùnùëÉsuperscript‚ÑùùëõP\subset\mathbb{R}^{n}italic_P ‚äÇ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, the (outer) normal cone of a kùëòkitalic_k-dimensional face FùêπFitalic_F of PùëÉPitalic_P is the (n‚àík)ùëõùëò(n-k)( italic_n - italic_k )-dimensional cone

NF‚Å¢(P)={x‚àà‚Ñùn|‚ü®z,x‚ü©=maxp‚ààP‚Å°‚ü®p,x‚ü©‚Å¢ for all ‚Å¢z‚ààF}.subscriptùëÅùêπùëÉconditional-setùë•superscript‚Ñùùëõùëßùë•subscriptùëùùëÉùëùùë• for all ùëßùêπN_{F}(P)=\left\{x\in\mathbb{R}^{n}\ \middle|\ \langle z,x\rangle=\max_{p\in P}% \langle p,x\rangle\text{ for all }z\in F\right\}.italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_F end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_P ) = { italic_x ‚àà blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | ‚ü® italic_z , italic_x ‚ü© = roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p ‚àà italic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ü® italic_p , italic_x ‚ü© for all italic_z ‚àà italic_F } . (1)

In particular, if P=Newt‚Å°(f)ùëÉNewtùëìP=\operatorname{Newt}(f)italic_P = roman_Newt ( italic_f ) and vùë£vitalic_v is a vertex of PùëÉPitalic_P, then the description of the normal cone turns into

Nv‚Å¢(Newt‚Å°(f))={x‚àà‚Ñùn|‚ü®v,x‚ü©=f‚Å¢(x)},subscriptùëÅùë£Newtùëìconditional-setùë•superscript‚Ñùùëõùë£ùë•ùëìùë•N_{v}(\operatorname{Newt}(f))=\left\{x\in\mathbb{R}^{n}\ \middle|\ \langle v,x% \rangle=f(x)\right\},italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( roman_Newt ( italic_f ) ) = { italic_x ‚àà blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | ‚ü® italic_v , italic_x ‚ü© = italic_f ( italic_x ) } ,

and agrees with a maximal polyhedron in ùí´fnsuperscriptsubscriptùí´ùëìùëõ\mathcal{P}_{f}^{n}caligraphic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. The normal fan of a polytope is the collection of normal cones over all faces. Thus, for positively homogeneous convex functions, the polyhedral complex ùí´fsubscriptùí´ùëì\mathcal{P}_{f}caligraphic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f end_POSTSUBSCRIPT agrees with the normal fan of Newt‚Å°(f)Newtùëì\operatorname{Newt}(f)roman_Newt ( italic_f ), and the number of linear pieces of fùëìfitalic_f equals the number of vertices of Newt‚Å°(f)Newtùëì\operatorname{Newt}(f)roman_Newt ( italic_f ). The duality between ùí´fsubscriptùí´ùëì\mathcal{P}_{f}caligraphic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and Newt‚Å°(f)Newtùëì\operatorname{Newt}(f)roman_Newt ( italic_f ) also establishes a bijection between faces œÉ‚ààùí´fn‚àí1ùúésuperscriptsubscriptùí´ùëìùëõ1\sigma\in\mathcal{P}_{f}^{n-1}italic_œÉ ‚àà caligraphic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and edges of Newt‚Å°(f)Newtùëì\operatorname{Newt}(f)roman_Newt ( italic_f ), and for the corresponding weight function wf‚ààùí≤ùí´subscriptùë§ùëìsubscriptùí≤ùí´w_{f}\in\mathcal{W}_{\mathcal{P}}italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àà caligraphic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT holds that wf‚Å¢(œÉ)subscriptùë§ùëìùúéw_{f}(\sigma)italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_œÉ ) equals the Euclidean length of the edge that is dual to œÉùúé\sigmaitalic_œÉ. This correspondence extends to general convex CWPL functions, where ùí´fsubscriptùí´ùëì\mathcal{P}_{f}caligraphic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is a complex which is dual to a polyhedral subdivision of Newt‚Å°(f)Newtùëì\operatorname{Newt}(f)roman_Newt ( italic_f ), and wfsubscriptùë§ùëìw_{f}italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f end_POSTSUBSCRIPT corresponds to lengths of edges in this subdivision (Maclagan & Sturmfels, 2015, Chapter 3.4).

C.2 The Construction from Tran & Wang (2024)

The duality between positively homogeneous convex CPWL functions and Newton polytopes, as described in Section C.1, serves as a motivation for Tran & Wang (2024) to construct minimal decompositions f=g‚àíhùëìùëî‚Ñéf=g-hitalic_f = italic_g - italic_h of positively homogeneous CPWL functions as the difference of two convex such functions in dimension 2222.

Theorem C.1 (Tran & Wang (2024)).

For every positively homogeneous CPWL-function f:‚Ñù2‚Üí‚Ñù:ùëì‚Üísuperscript‚Ñù2‚Ñùf\colon\mathbb{R}^{2}\to\mathbb{R}italic_f : blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Üí blackboard_R exists a unique (up to adding a linear function) minimal representation as difference of two convex functions g,hùëî‚Ñég,hitalic_g , italic_h.

The decomposition can be obtained as follows. Let ùí´fsubscriptùí´ùëì\mathcal{P}_{f}caligraphic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f end_POSTSUBSCRIPT be a 2222-dimensional polyhedral fan compatible with fùëìfitalic_f with rays œÅ1,‚Ä¶,œÅm‚äÇ‚Ñù2subscriptùúå1‚Ä¶subscriptùúåùëösuperscript‚Ñù2\rho_{1},\dots,\rho_{m}\subset\mathbb{R}^{2}italic_œÅ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ‚Ä¶ , italic_œÅ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚äÇ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and ray generators r1,‚Ä¶,rm‚àà‚Ñù2subscriptùëü1‚Ä¶subscriptùëüùëösuperscript‚Ñù2r_{1},\dots,r_{m}\in\mathbb{R}^{2}italic_r start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ‚Ä¶ , italic_r start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àà blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT such that ‚Äñri‚Äñ=1normsubscriptùëüùëñ1\|r_{i}\|=1‚à• italic_r start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚à• = 1 for i=1,‚Ä¶,mùëñ1‚Ä¶ùëöi=1,\dots,mitalic_i = 1 , ‚Ä¶ , italic_m. Furthermore, let wfsubscriptùë§ùëìw_{f}italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f end_POSTSUBSCRIPT be the corresponding element in ùí≤ùí´fsubscriptùí≤subscriptùí´ùëì\mathcal{W}_{\mathcal{P}_{f}}caligraphic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and wf+‚âîmax‚Å°{wf,0}‚âîsubscriptsuperscriptùë§ùëìsubscriptùë§ùëì0w^{+}_{f}\coloneqq\max\{w_{f},0\}italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚âî roman_max { italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , 0 }. We now define an additional ray œÅm+1subscriptùúåùëö1\rho_{m+1}italic_œÅ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT with ray generator rm+1=‚àí‚àëi=1mmax‚Å°(wf‚Å¢(œÅi),0)‚Å¢risubscriptùëüùëö1superscriptsubscriptùëñ1ùëösubscriptùë§ùëìsubscriptùúåùëñ0subscriptùëüùëñr_{m+1}=-\sum_{i=1}^{m}\max(w_{f}(\rho_{i}),0)r_{i}italic_r start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = - ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_max ( italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_œÅ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) , 0 ) italic_r start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and a convex function gùëîgitalic_g through the weights

wg‚Å¢(œÅi)={wf‚Å¢(œÅi)if ‚Å¢wf‚Å¢(œÅi)>0,i‚àà[m]0if ‚Å¢wf‚Å¢(œÅi)‚â§0,i‚àà[m]‚àëi=1mmax‚Å°(wf‚Å¢(œÅi),0)if ‚Å¢i=m+1.subscriptùë§ùëîsubscriptùúåùëñcasessubscriptùë§ùëìsubscriptùúåùëñformulae-sequenceif subscriptùë§ùëìsubscriptùúåùëñ0ùëñdelimited-[]ùëö0formulae-sequenceif subscriptùë§ùëìsubscriptùúåùëñ0ùëñdelimited-[]ùëösuperscriptsubscriptùëñ1ùëösubscriptùë§ùëìsubscriptùúåùëñ0if ùëñùëö1w_{g}(\rho_{i})=\begin{cases}w_{f}(\rho_{i})&\text{if }w_{f}(\rho_{i})>0,i\in[% m]\\ 0&\text{if }w_{f}(\rho_{i})\leq 0,i\in[m]\\ \sum_{i=1}^{m}\max(w_{f}(\rho_{i}),0)&\text{if }i=m+1.\end{cases}italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_g end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_œÅ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = { start_ROW start_CELL italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_œÅ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_CELL start_CELL if italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_œÅ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) > 0 , italic_i ‚àà [ italic_m ] end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL 0 end_CELL start_CELL if italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_œÅ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ‚â§ 0 , italic_i ‚àà [ italic_m ] end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_max ( italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_œÅ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) , 0 ) end_CELL start_CELL if italic_i = italic_m + 1 . end_CELL end_ROW

This defines the convex functions gùëîgitalic_g, h=g‚àíf‚Ñéùëîùëìh=g-fitalic_h = italic_g - italic_f, and results in a minimal decomposition f=g‚àíhùëìùëî‚Ñéf=g-hitalic_f = italic_g - italic_h in the 2-dimensional positively homogeneous case. Considering this construction through to the duality to Newton polytopes, we can identify rays of ùí´fsubscriptùí´ùëì\mathcal{P}_{f}caligraphic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f end_POSTSUBSCRIPT which correspond to convex breakpoints of fùëìfitalic_f with edges of the Newton polytope Newt‚Å°(g)Newtùëî\operatorname{Newt}(g)roman_Newt ( italic_g ), and the construction from Theorem C.1 adds a "missing" edge to the Newton polygon Newt‚Å°(g)Newtùëî\operatorname{Newt}(g)roman_Newt ( italic_g ). We now describe the proposed construction to generalize the 2222-dimensional method to higher dimensions.

Construction C.2 (Tran & Wang (2024, Section 4.1)).

Let f:‚Ñùn‚Üí‚Ñù:ùëì‚Üísuperscript‚Ñùùëõ‚Ñùf\colon\mathbb{R}^{n}\to\mathbb{R}italic_f : blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Üí blackboard_R be a positively homogeneous CWPL-function and ùí´ùí´\mathcal{P}caligraphic_P a polyhedral fan compatible with fùëìfitalic_f. The attempt is to balance wf+subscriptsuperscriptùë§ùëìw^{+}_{f}italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f end_POSTSUBSCRIPT locally around every œÑ‚ààùí´n‚àí2ùúèsuperscriptùí´ùëõ2\tau\in\mathcal{P}^{n-2}italic_œÑ ‚àà caligraphic_P start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n - 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and then ‚Äúglue together" the local balancings to a global balancing. So, for some œÑ‚ààùí´n‚àí2ùúèsuperscriptùí´ùëõ2\tau\in\mathcal{P}^{n-2}italic_œÑ ‚àà caligraphic_P start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n - 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, suppose that {œÉ1,‚Ä¶‚Å¢œÉk}=starùí´‚Å°(œÑ)subscriptùúé1‚Ä¶subscriptùúéùëòsubscriptstarùí´ùúè\{\sigma_{1},\ldots\sigma_{k}\}=\operatorname{star}_{\mathcal{P}}(\tau){ italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ‚Ä¶ italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } = roman_star start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_œÑ ) are the cones containing œÑùúè\tauitalic_œÑ. The rays spanned by eœÉi/œÑsubscriptùëísubscriptùúéùëñùúèe_{\sigma_{i}/\tau}italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_œÑ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT that inherit the weights wf+‚Å¢(œÉi)subscriptsuperscriptùë§ùëìsubscriptùúéùëñw^{+}_{f}(\sigma_{i})italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) for i‚àà[k]ùëñdelimited-[]ùëòi\in[k]italic_i ‚àà [ italic_k ] induce a 2222-dimensional fan ùí´œÑsubscriptùí´ùúè\mathcal{P}_{\tau}caligraphic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÑ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT in the 2222-dimensional linear space span(œÑ)‚üÇ\operatorname{span}(\tau)^{\perp}roman_span ( italic_œÑ ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚üÇ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT orthogonal to span‚Å°(œÑ)spanùúè\operatorname{span}(\tau)roman_span ( italic_œÑ ). Let PœÑsubscriptùëÉùúèP_{\tau}italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÑ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT be the polygon in span(œÑ)‚üÇ\operatorname{span}(\tau)^{\perp}roman_span ( italic_œÑ ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚üÇ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT corresponding to the minimal balancing of wf+subscriptsuperscriptùë§ùëìw^{+}_{f}italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f end_POSTSUBSCRIPT regarded as map wf+:ùí´œÑ1‚Üí‚Ñù:subscriptsuperscriptùë§ùëì‚Üísuperscriptsubscriptùí´ùúè1‚Ñùw^{+}_{f}\colon\mathcal{P}_{\tau}^{1}\to\mathbb{R}italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f end_POSTSUBSCRIPT : caligraphic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÑ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Üí blackboard_R. Now proceed with the following steps.

  1. 1.

    For every œÑ‚ààùí´n‚àí2ùúèsuperscriptùí´ùëõ2\tau\in\mathcal{P}^{n-2}italic_œÑ ‚àà caligraphic_P start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n - 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, construct the polygon PœÑsubscriptùëÉùúèP_{\tau}italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÑ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT.

  2. 2.

    Place the polygons PœÑsubscriptùëÉùúèP_{\tau}italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÑ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT in ‚Ñùnsuperscript‚Ñùùëõ\mathbb{R}^{n}blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT in such a way, that whenever œÑ1,œÑ2‚ààùí´n‚àí2subscriptùúè1subscriptùúè2superscriptùí´ùëõ2\tau_{1},\tau_{2}\in\mathcal{P}^{n-2}italic_œÑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_œÑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àà caligraphic_P start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n - 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT are faces of œÉ‚ààsuppùí´+‚Å°(f)ùúésubscriptsuperscriptsuppùí´ùëì\sigma\in\operatorname{supp}^{+}_{\mathcal{P}}(f)italic_œÉ ‚àà roman_supp start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_f ), then the edges in PœÑ1subscriptùëÉsubscriptùúè1P_{\tau_{1}}italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and PœÑ2subscriptùëÉsubscriptùúè2P_{\tau_{2}}italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT that correspond to œÉùúé\sigmaitalic_œÉ are identified with each other.

  3. 3.

    Take the convex hull PgsubscriptùëÉùëîP_{g}italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_g end_POSTSUBSCRIPT of the polygons {PœÑ}œÑ‚ààùí´n‚àí2subscriptsubscriptùëÉùúèùúèsuperscriptùí´ùëõ2\{P_{\tau}\}_{\tau\in\mathcal{P}^{n-2}}{ italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÑ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÑ ‚àà caligraphic_P start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n - 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT.

  4. 4.

    The support function gùëîgitalic_g of the polytope PgsubscriptùëÉùëîP_{g}italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_g end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and h‚âîg‚àíf‚âî‚Ñéùëîùëìh\coloneqq g-fitalic_h ‚âî italic_g - italic_f are a decomposition of fùëìfitalic_f.

One can check that for some œÉ‚ààùí´n‚àí1ùúésuperscriptùí´ùëõ1\sigma\in\mathcal{P}^{n-1}italic_œÉ ‚àà caligraphic_P start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and œÑ‚ààùí´n‚àí2ùúèsuperscriptùí´ùëõ2\tau\in\mathcal{P}^{n-2}italic_œÑ ‚àà caligraphic_P start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n - 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT being a face of œÉùúé\sigmaitalic_œÉ, the edge eœÉsubscriptùëíùúée_{\sigma}italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÉ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT of length w‚Å¢(œÉ)ùë§ùúéw(\sigma)italic_w ( italic_œÉ ) which is perpendicular in span(œÑ)‚üÇ\operatorname{span}(\tau)^{\perp}roman_span ( italic_œÑ ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚üÇ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT to œÑùúè\tauitalic_œÑ is independent of the choice of the face œÑùúè\tauitalic_œÑ. In particular, the direction of the edge eœÉsubscriptùëíùúée_{\sigma}italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÉ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is normal to the hyperplane spanned by œÉùúé\sigmaitalic_œÉ. However, it remained unclear, whether or not, the second step in this procedure is always well-defined, that is, that placing the polygons in such a coherent way is possible. To make this more precise, let for some œÑ‚ààùí´n‚àí2ùúèsuperscriptùí´ùëõ2\tau\in\mathcal{P}^{n-2}italic_œÑ ‚àà caligraphic_P start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n - 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT the edges of the polygon PœÑsubscriptùëÉùúèP_{\tau}italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÑ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT be given in a cyclic way {eœÉ1,‚Ä¶‚Å¢eœÉm}subscriptùëísubscriptùúé1‚Ä¶subscriptùëísubscriptùúéùëö\{e_{\sigma_{1}},\ldots e_{\sigma_{m}}\}{ italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ‚Ä¶ italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT }. Placing a polygon PœÑsubscriptùëÉùúèP_{\tau}italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÑ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT refers to choosing an xœÑ‚àà‚Ñùnsubscriptùë•ùúèsuperscript‚Ñùùëõx_{\tau}\in\mathbb{R}^{n}italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÑ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àà blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and defining the placed polygon as PœÑ‚Å¢(xœÑ)=conv‚Å°(xœÑ,xœÑ+eœÉ1,xœÑ+eœÉ1+eœÉ2,‚Ä¶,xœÑ+‚àëi=1meœÉm)subscriptùëÉùúèsubscriptùë•ùúèconvsubscriptùë•ùúèsubscriptùë•ùúèsubscriptùëísubscriptùúé1subscriptùë•ùúèsubscriptùëísubscriptùúé1subscriptùëísubscriptùúé2‚Ä¶subscriptùë•ùúèsuperscriptsubscriptùëñ1ùëösubscriptùëísubscriptùúéùëöP_{\tau}(x_{\tau})=\operatorname{conv}(x_{\tau},x_{\tau}+e_{\sigma_{1}},x_{% \tau}+e_{\sigma_{1}}+e_{\sigma_{2}},\ldots,x_{\tau}+\sum_{i=1}^{m}e_{\sigma_{m% }})italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÑ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÑ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = roman_conv ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÑ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÑ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÑ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ‚Ä¶ , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÑ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ). Placing them in a coherent way means choosing an xœÑ‚àà‚Ñùnsubscriptùë•ùúèsuperscript‚Ñùùëõx_{\tau}\in\mathbb{R}^{n}italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÑ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àà blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT for every œÑ‚ààùí´n‚àí2ùúèsuperscriptùí´ùëõ2\tau\in\mathcal{P}^{n-2}italic_œÑ ‚àà caligraphic_P start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n - 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT such that PœÑ1‚Å¢(xœÑ1)‚à©PœÑ2‚Å¢(xœÑ2)=conv‚Å°(xœÉ,xœÉ+eœÉ)subscriptùëÉsubscriptùúè1subscriptùë•subscriptùúè1subscriptùëÉsubscriptùúè2subscriptùë•subscriptùúè2convsubscriptùë•ùúésubscriptùë•ùúésubscriptùëíùúéP_{\tau_{1}}(x_{\tau_{1}})\cap P_{\tau_{2}}(x_{\tau_{2}})=\operatorname{conv}(% x_{\sigma},x_{\sigma}+e_{\sigma})italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ‚à© italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = roman_conv ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÉ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÉ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÉ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) for some xœÉ‚àà‚Ñùnsubscriptùë•ùúésuperscript‚Ñùùëõx_{\sigma}\in\mathbb{R}^{n}italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÉ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àà blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT whenever œÑ1subscriptùúè1\tau_{1}italic_œÑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and œÑ2subscriptùúè2\tau_{2}italic_œÑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT are faces of œÉùúé\sigmaitalic_œÉ. A priori it is not clear that such xœÑsubscriptùë•ùúèx_{\tau}italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÑ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT always exist. The following example will in fact show that the resulting linear equation system not always yields a solution.

C.3 Counterexample to the construction

In the remaining of this section, we give a counterexample to Construction C.2, which is stated in Tran & Wang (2024) in terms of (virtual) Newton polytopes as a potential generalization of the 2222-dimensional construction to higher dimensions.

Example C.3 (Counterexample to Construction C.2).

Figure 4 is an illustration of 4444 polygons with labelled edges that cannot be placed in ‚Ñù3superscript‚Ñù3\mathbb{R}^{3}blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 3 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT such that the edges of different polygons with the same label are identified with each other. Hence, applying the above procedure to the CPWL-function f:‚Ñù3‚Üí‚Ñù:ùëì‚Üísuperscript‚Ñù3‚Ñùf\colon\mathbb{R}^{3}\to\mathbb{R}italic_f : blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 3 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Üí blackboard_R given by

f‚Å¢(x)=max‚Å°{0,maxi,j‚àà[3]i‚â†j‚Å°{min‚Å°{xi,xj‚àíxi}}}ùëìùë•0subscriptùëñùëódelimited-[]3ùëñùëósubscriptùë•ùëñsubscriptùë•ùëósubscriptùë•ùëñf(x)=\max\{0,\max\limits_{\begin{subarray}{c}i,j\in[3]\\ i\neq j\end{subarray}}\{\min\{x_{i},x_{j}-x_{i}\}\}\}italic_f ( italic_x ) = roman_max { 0 , roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_ARG start_ROW start_CELL italic_i , italic_j ‚àà [ 3 ] end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL italic_i ‚â† italic_j end_CELL end_ROW end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT { roman_min { italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } } }

is not well-defined since these 4444 polygons arise and should be identified in the indicated way, which is impossible.

We describe the 2222-skeleton of a polyhedral fan ùí´ùí´\mathcal{P}caligraphic_P that is compatible with fùëìfitalic_f. Let eisubscriptùëíùëñe_{i}italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT be the iùëñiitalic_i-th standard unit vector. The rays are given as follows:

ùí´1={cone(‚àíei),cone(ei),cone(ei+ej),cone(ei+ej+2ek),cone(ei+2ej+2ek),cone(ei+ej+2ek),cone(ei+ej+ek)‚à£i,j,k‚àà[3] pairwise distinct}superscriptùí´1conditional-setconesubscriptùëíùëñconesubscriptùëíùëñconesubscriptùëíùëñsubscriptùëíùëóconesubscriptùëíùëñsubscriptùëíùëó2subscriptùëíùëòconesubscriptùëíùëñ2subscriptùëíùëó2subscriptùëíùëòconesubscriptùëíùëñsubscriptùëíùëó2subscriptùëíùëòconesubscriptùëíùëñsubscriptùëíùëósubscriptùëíùëòùëñùëóùëòdelimited-[]3 pairwise distinct\mathcal{P}^{1}=\{\operatorname{cone}(-e_{i}),\operatorname{cone}(e_{i}),% \operatorname{cone}(e_{i}+e_{j}),\operatorname{cone}(e_{i}+e_{j}+2e_{k}),% \operatorname{cone}(e_{i}+2e_{j}+2e_{k}),\\ \operatorname{cone}(e_{i}+e_{j}+2e_{k}),\operatorname{cone}(e_{i}+e_{j}+e_{k})% \mid i,j,k\in[3]\text{ pairwise distinct}\}start_ROW start_CELL caligraphic_P start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = { roman_cone ( - italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) , roman_cone ( italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) , roman_cone ( italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) , roman_cone ( italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 2 italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) , roman_cone ( italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 2 italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 2 italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) , end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL roman_cone ( italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 2 italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) , roman_cone ( italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ‚à£ italic_i , italic_j , italic_k ‚àà [ 3 ] pairwise distinct } end_CELL end_ROW

and the 2222-dimensional cones as

ùí´2={\displaystyle\mathcal{P}^{2}=\{caligraphic_P start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = { cone‚Å°(ei,‚àíej),cone‚Å°(‚àíei,ei+ej+2‚Å¢ek),cone‚Å°(‚àíei,ej+ek),cone‚Å°(ei,ei+ej+2‚Å¢ek),conesubscriptùëíùëñsubscriptùëíùëóconesubscriptùëíùëñsubscriptùëíùëñsubscriptùëíùëó2subscriptùëíùëòconesubscriptùëíùëñsubscriptùëíùëósubscriptùëíùëòconesubscriptùëíùëñsubscriptùëíùëñsubscriptùëíùëó2subscriptùëíùëò\displaystyle\operatorname{cone}(e_{i},-e_{j}),\operatorname{cone}(-e_{i},e_{i% }+e_{j}+2e_{k}),\operatorname{cone}(-e_{i},e_{j}+e_{k}),\operatorname{cone}(e_% {i},e_{i}+e_{j}+2e_{k}),roman_cone ( italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , - italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) , roman_cone ( - italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 2 italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) , roman_cone ( - italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) , roman_cone ( italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 2 italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ,
cone‚Å°(ej+ek,ei+ej+2‚Å¢ek),cone‚Å°(ei+ej+2‚Å¢ek,ei+2‚Å¢ej+2‚Å¢ek),cone‚Å°(ei+ej+2‚Å¢ek,ei+ej+ek),conesubscriptùëíùëósubscriptùëíùëòsubscriptùëíùëñsubscriptùëíùëó2subscriptùëíùëòconesubscriptùëíùëñsubscriptùëíùëó2subscriptùëíùëòsubscriptùëíùëñ2subscriptùëíùëó2subscriptùëíùëòconesubscriptùëíùëñsubscriptùëíùëó2subscriptùëíùëòsubscriptùëíùëñsubscriptùëíùëósubscriptùëíùëò\displaystyle\operatorname{cone}(e_{j}+e_{k},e_{i}+e_{j}+2e_{k}),\operatorname% {cone}(e_{i}+e_{j}+2e_{k},e_{i}+2e_{j}+2e_{k}),\operatorname{cone}(e_{i}+e_{j}% +2e_{k},e_{i}+e_{j}+e_{k}),roman_cone ( italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 2 italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) , roman_cone ( italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 2 italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 2 italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 2 italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) , roman_cone ( italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 2 italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ,
cone(ei+2ej+2ek,ei+ej+ek),cone(ej+ek,ei+2ej+2ek)‚à£i,j,k‚àà[3] pairwise distinct}\displaystyle\operatorname{cone}(e_{i}+2e_{j}+2e_{k},e_{i}+e_{j}+e_{k}),% \operatorname{cone}(e_{j}+e_{k},e_{i}+2e_{j}+2e_{k})\mid i,j,k\in[3]\text{ % pairwise distinct}\}roman_cone ( italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 2 italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 2 italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) , roman_cone ( italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 2 italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 2 italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ‚à£ italic_i , italic_j , italic_k ‚àà [ 3 ] pairwise distinct }

The weight function wf:ùí´2‚Üí‚Ñù:subscriptùë§ùëì‚Üísuperscriptùí´2‚Ñùw_{f}\colon\mathcal{P}^{2}\to\mathbb{R}italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f end_POSTSUBSCRIPT : caligraphic_P start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Üí blackboard_R given by

w‚Å¢(cone‚Å°(ei,‚àíej))=1ùë§conesubscriptùëíùëñsubscriptùëíùëó1\displaystyle w(\operatorname{cone}(e_{i},-e_{j}))=1italic_w ( roman_cone ( italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , - italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) = 1
w‚Å¢(cone‚Å°(‚àíei,ei+ej+2‚Å¢ek))=‚àí5ùë§conesubscriptùëíùëñsubscriptùëíùëñsubscriptùëíùëó2subscriptùëíùëò5\displaystyle w(\operatorname{cone}(-e_{i},e_{i}+e_{j}+2e_{k}))=-\sqrt{5}italic_w ( roman_cone ( - italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 2 italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) = - square-root start_ARG 5 end_ARG
w‚Å¢(cone‚Å°(‚àíei,ej+ek))=8ùë§conesubscriptùëíùëñsubscriptùëíùëósubscriptùëíùëò8\displaystyle w(\operatorname{cone}(-e_{i},e_{j}+e_{k}))=\sqrt{8}italic_w ( roman_cone ( - italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) = square-root start_ARG 8 end_ARG
w‚Å¢(cone‚Å°(ei,ei+ej+2‚Å¢ek))=2,ùë§conesubscriptùëíùëñsubscriptùëíùëñsubscriptùëíùëó2subscriptùëíùëò2\displaystyle w(\operatorname{cone}(e_{i},e_{i}+e_{j}+2e_{k}))=\sqrt{2},italic_w ( roman_cone ( italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 2 italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) = square-root start_ARG 2 end_ARG ,

corresponds to the function fùëìfitalic_f and is therefore balanced. See Figure 5 for a 2222-dimensional illustration of ùí´ùí´\mathcal{P}caligraphic_P.

Consider the 4444 rays

œÅ1=cone‚Å°((0,1,1)),œÅ2=cone‚Å°((1,1,2)),œÅ3=cone‚Å°((1,2,1)),œÅ4=cone‚Å°((1,1,1))formulae-sequencesubscriptùúå1cone011formulae-sequencesubscriptùúå2cone112formulae-sequencesubscriptùúå3cone121subscriptùúå4cone111\displaystyle\rho_{1}=\operatorname{cone}((0,1,1)),\rho_{2}=\operatorname{cone% }((1,1,2)),\rho_{3}=\operatorname{cone}((1,2,1)),\rho_{4}=\operatorname{cone}(% (1,1,1))italic_œÅ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = roman_cone ( ( 0 , 1 , 1 ) ) , italic_œÅ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = roman_cone ( ( 1 , 1 , 2 ) ) , italic_œÅ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 3 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = roman_cone ( ( 1 , 2 , 1 ) ) , italic_œÅ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 4 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = roman_cone ( ( 1 , 1 , 1 ) )

The 2222-dimensional cones which are in the stars of the 4444 rays are the following:

œÉ13=cone‚Å°((1,2,2),(1,1,1)),subscriptùúé13cone122111\displaystyle\sigma_{13}=\operatorname{cone}((1,2,2),(1,1,1)),italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 13 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = roman_cone ( ( 1 , 2 , 2 ) , ( 1 , 1 , 1 ) ) ,

The direction of the edges of the polygons are given by the normal vectors of the hyperplanes spanned by the corresponding 2222-dimensional cone and their length by the weight of the corresponding 2222-dimensional cone.

eœÉ1=(0,2,‚àí2),eœÉ2=(1,‚àí1,1),eœÉ3=(‚àí1,‚àí1,1),eœÉ4=(1,‚àí1,0),eœÉ5=(1,1,‚àí1),formulae-sequencesubscriptùëísubscriptùúé1022formulae-sequencesubscriptùëísubscriptùúé2111formulae-sequencesubscriptùëísubscriptùúé3111formulae-sequencesubscriptùëísubscriptùúé4110subscriptùëísubscriptùúé5111\displaystyle e_{\sigma_{1}}=(0,2,-2),\,e_{\sigma_{2}}=(1,-1,1),\,e_{\sigma_{3% }}=(-1,-1,1),\,e_{\sigma_{4}}=(1,-1,0),\,e_{\sigma_{5}}=(1,1,-1),\,italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = ( 0 , 2 , - 2 ) , italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = ( 1 , - 1 , 1 ) , italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 3 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = ( - 1 , - 1 , 1 ) , italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 4 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = ( 1 , - 1 , 0 ) , italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 5 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = ( 1 , 1 , - 1 ) ,
eœÉ6=(‚àí1,1,0),eœÉ7=(1,0,‚àí1),eœÉ8=(‚àí1,1,‚àí1),eœÉ9=(‚àí1,0,1),eœÉ10=(1,‚àí1,0),formulae-sequencesubscriptùëísubscriptùúé6110formulae-sequencesubscriptùëísubscriptùúé7101formulae-sequencesubscriptùëísubscriptùúé8111formulae-sequencesubscriptùëísubscriptùúé9101subscriptùëísubscriptùúé10110\displaystyle e_{\sigma_{6}}=(-1,1,0),\,e_{\sigma_{7}}=(1,0,-1),\,e_{\sigma_{8% }}=(-1,1,-1),\,e_{\sigma_{9}}=(-1,0,1),\,e_{\sigma_{10}}=(1,-1,0),italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 6 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = ( - 1 , 1 , 0 ) , italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 7 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = ( 1 , 0 , - 1 ) , italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 8 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = ( - 1 , 1 , - 1 ) , italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 9 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = ( - 1 , 0 , 1 ) , italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 10 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = ( 1 , - 1 , 0 ) ,
eœÉ11=(0,‚àí1,1),eœÉ12=(‚àí1,0,1),eœÉ13=(0,1,‚àí1)formulae-sequencesubscriptùëísubscriptùúé11011formulae-sequencesubscriptùëísubscriptùúé12101subscriptùëísubscriptùúé13011\displaystyle e_{\sigma_{11}}=(0,-1,1),\,e_{\sigma_{12}}=(-1,0,1),\,e_{\sigma_% {13}}=(0,1,-1)italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 11 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = ( 0 , - 1 , 1 ) , italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 12 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = ( - 1 , 0 , 1 ) , italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 13 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = ( 0 , 1 , - 1 )

In order to construct the polygons one needs to consider the orientation of the edge (and the normal vector) in the particular polygon. One can convince themselves that the polygons PœÅ1,PœÅ3,PœÅ3subscriptùëÉsubscriptùúå1subscriptùëÉsubscriptùúå3subscriptùëÉsubscriptùúå3P_{\rho_{1}},P_{\rho_{3}},P_{\rho_{3}}italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÅ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÅ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 3 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÅ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 3 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and PœÅ4subscriptùëÉsubscriptùúå4P_{\rho_{4}}italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÅ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 4 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT of the 4444 rays are given as:

PœÅ1‚Å¢(xœÅ1)subscriptùëÉsubscriptùúå1subscriptùë•subscriptùúå1\displaystyle P_{\rho_{1}}(x_{\rho_{1}})italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÅ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÅ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) =conv‚Å°(xœÅ1+eœÉ1,xœÅ1+eœÉ1+eœÉ2,xœÅ1+eœÉ1+eœÉ2+eœÉ3)absentconvsubscriptùë•subscriptùúå1subscriptùëísubscriptùúé1subscriptùë•subscriptùúå1subscriptùëísubscriptùúé1subscriptùëísubscriptùúé2subscriptùë•subscriptùúå1subscriptùëísubscriptùúé1subscriptùëísubscriptùúé2subscriptùëísubscriptùúé3\displaystyle=\operatorname{conv}(x_{\rho_{1}}+e_{\sigma_{1}},x_{\rho_{1}}+e_{% \sigma_{1}}+e_{\sigma_{2}},x_{\rho_{1}}+e_{\sigma_{1}}+e_{\sigma_{2}}+e_{% \sigma_{3}})= roman_conv ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÅ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÅ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÅ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 3 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT )
PœÅ2‚Å¢(xœÅ2)subscriptùëÉsubscriptùúå2subscriptùë•subscriptùúå2\displaystyle P_{\rho_{2}}(x_{\rho_{2}})italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÅ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÅ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) =conv‚Å°(xœÅ2‚àíeœÉ3,xœÅ2‚àíeœÉ3‚àíeœÉ4,xœÅ2‚àíeœÉ3‚àíeœÉ4‚àíeœÉ5,xœÅ2‚àíeœÉ3‚àíeœÉ4‚àíeœÉ5‚àíeœÉ6)absentconvsubscriptùë•subscriptùúå2subscriptùëísubscriptùúé3subscriptùë•subscriptùúå2subscriptùëísubscriptùúé3subscriptùëísubscriptùúé4subscriptùë•subscriptùúå2subscriptùëísubscriptùúé3subscriptùëísubscriptùúé4subscriptùëísubscriptùúé5subscriptùë•subscriptùúå2subscriptùëísubscriptùúé3subscriptùëísubscriptùúé4subscriptùëísubscriptùúé5subscriptùëísubscriptùúé6\displaystyle=\operatorname{conv}(x_{\rho_{2}}-e_{\sigma_{3}},x_{\rho_{2}}-e_{% \sigma_{3}}-e_{\sigma_{4}},x_{\rho_{2}}-e_{\sigma_{3}}-e_{\sigma_{4}}-e_{% \sigma_{5}},x_{\rho_{2}}-e_{\sigma_{3}}-e_{\sigma_{4}}-e_{\sigma_{5}}-e_{% \sigma_{6}})= roman_conv ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÅ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - PœÅ3‚Å¢(xœÅ3)subscriptùëÉsubscriptùúå3subscriptùë•subscriptùúå3\displaystyle P_{\rho_{3}}(x_{\rho_{3}})italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÅ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 3 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÅ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 3 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) =conv‚Å°(xœÅ3‚àíeœÉ2,xœÅ3‚àíeœÉ2+eœÉ7,xœÅ3‚àíeœÉ2+eœÉ7+eœÉ8,xœÅ3‚àíeœÉ2+eœÉ7+eœÉ8+eœÉ9)absentconvsubscriptùë•subscriptùúå3subscriptùëísubscriptùúé2subscriptùë•subscriptùúå3subscriptùëísubscriptùúé2subscriptùëísubscriptùúé7subscriptùë•subscriptùúå3subscriptùëísubscriptùúé2subscriptùëísubscriptùúé7subscriptùëísubscriptùúé8subscriptùë•subscriptùúå3subscriptùëísubscriptùúé2subscriptùëísubscriptùúé7subscriptùëísubscriptùúé8subscriptùëísubscriptùúé9\displaystyle=\operatorname{conv}(x_{\rho_{3}}-e_{\sigma_{2}},x_{\rho_{3}}-e_{% \sigma_{2}}+e_{\sigma_{7}},x_{\rho_{3}}-e_{\sigma_{2}}+e_{\sigma_{7}}+e_{% \sigma_{8}},x_{\rho_{3}}-e_{\sigma_{2}}+e_{\sigma_{7}}+e_{\sigma_{8}}+e_{% \sigma_{9}})= roman_conv ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÅ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 3 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - xœÅ4+eœÉ9+eœÉ10+eœÉ11+eœÉ12+eœÉ4,xœÅ4+eœÉ9+eœÉ10+eœÉ11+eœÉ12+eœÉ4+eœÉ13)\displaystyle x_{\rho_{4}}+e_{\sigma_{9}}+e_{\sigma_{10}}+e_{\sigma_{11}}+e_{% \sigma_{12}}+e_{\sigma_{4}},x_{\rho_{4}}+e_{\sigma_{9}}+e_{\sigma_{10}}+e_{% \sigma_{11}}+e_{\sigma_{12}}+e_{\sigma_{4}}+e_{\sigma_{13}})italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÅ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 4 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 9 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 10 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 11 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 12 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 4 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÅ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 4 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 9 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 10 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 11 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 12 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 4 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 13 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT )

Figure 4 already shows that they cannot be placed in a coherent way.
