To make this mathematically precise, one obtains a system of linear equations for xœÅ1,xœÅ2,xœÅ3subscriptùë•subscriptùúå1subscriptùë•subscriptùúå2subscriptùë•subscriptùúå3x_{\rho_{1}},x_{\rho_{2}},x_{\rho_{3}}italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÅ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÅ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÅ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 3 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and xœÅ4subscriptùë•subscriptùúå4x_{\rho_{4}}italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÅ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 4 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, by plugging in the values for the normal vectors, that ensures that the edges for the same 2222-dimensional cone in different polygons are identified. This linear equation system does not have a solution.

Appendix D Submodular Functions

This section is a detailed version of Section 5, where we demonstrate that a special case of our framework is to decompose a general set function into a difference of submodular set funtions and translate our results to this setting. Such decompositions are a popular approach to solve optimization problems as disussed in the introduction.

Definition D.1.

The braid arrangement in ‚Ñùnsuperscript‚Ñùùëõ\mathbb{R}^{n}blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is the hyperplane arrangement consisting of the (n2)binomialùëõ2\binom{n}{2}( FRACOP start_ARG italic_n end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG ) hyperplanes xi=xjsubscriptùë•ùëñsubscriptùë•ùëóx_{i}=x_{j}italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, with 1‚â§i<j‚â§n1ùëñùëóùëõ1\leq i<j\leq n1 ‚â§ italic_i < italic_j ‚â§ italic_n.

For the remaining section, let ùí´ùí´\mathcal{P}caligraphic_P be the polyhedral complex arising from the braid arrangement. Let ‚Ñ±nsubscript‚Ñ±ùëõ\mathcal{F}_{n}caligraphic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT be the vector space of set functions from 2[n]superscript2delimited-[]ùëõ2^{[n]}2 start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT [ italic_n ] end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT to ‚Ñù‚Ñù\mathbb{R}blackboard_R. We first show that functions in ùí±ùí´subscriptùí±ùí´\mathcal{V}_{\mathcal{P}}caligraphic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT are in one-to-one correspondence with the set functions ‚Ñ±nsubscript‚Ñ±ùëõ\mathcal{F}_{n}caligraphic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. To this end, for a set S‚äÜ[n]ùëÜdelimited-[]ùëõS\subseteq[n]italic_S ‚äÜ [ italic_n ], let ùüôS=‚àëi‚ààSeisubscript1ùëÜsubscriptùëñùëÜsubscriptùëíùëñ\mathds{1}_{S}=\sum_{i\in S}e_{i}blackboard_1 start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_S end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i ‚àà italic_S end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT be the indicator vector of SùëÜSitalic_S, that is, the vector that contains entries 1111 for indices in SùëÜSitalic_S and 00 otherwise.

Proposition D.2.

The mapping Œ¶Œ¶\Phiroman_Œ¶ that maps f‚ààùí±ùí´ùëìsubscriptùí±ùí´f\in\mathcal{V}_{\mathcal{P}}italic_f ‚àà caligraphic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT to the set function F‚Å¢(S)=f‚Å¢(ùüôS)ùêπùëÜùëìsubscript1ùëÜF(S)=f(\mathds{1}_{S})italic_F ( italic_S ) = italic_f ( blackboard_1 start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_S end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) is a vector space isomorphism.

Proof.

The map Œ¶Œ¶\Phiroman_Œ¶ is clearly a linear map. To prove that Œ¶Œ¶\Phiroman_Œ¶ is an isomorphism, we show that a function f‚ààùí±ùí´ùëìsubscriptùí±ùí´f\in\mathcal{V}_{\mathcal{P}}italic_f ‚àà caligraphic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is uniquely determined by its values on {ùüôS}S‚äÜ[n]subscriptsubscript1ùëÜùëÜdelimited-[]ùëõ\{\mathds{1}_{S}\}_{S\subseteq[n]}{ blackboard_1 start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_S end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_S ‚äÜ [ italic_n ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and any choice of real values {yS}S‚äÜ[n]subscriptsubscriptùë¶ùëÜùëÜdelimited-[]ùëõ\{y_{S}\}_{S\subseteq[n]}{ italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_S end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_S ‚äÜ [ italic_n ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT give rise to a function f‚ààùí±ùí´ùëìsubscriptùí±ùí´f\in\mathcal{V}_{\mathcal{P}}italic_f ‚àà caligraphic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT such that f‚Å¢(ùüôS)=ySùëìsubscript1ùëÜsubscriptùë¶ùëÜf(\mathds{1}_{S})=y_{S}italic_f ( blackboard_1 start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_S end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_S end_POSTSUBSCRIPT.

First, note that the maximal polyhedra ùí´nsuperscriptùí´ùëõ\mathcal{P}^{n}caligraphic_P start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT are of the form PœÄ={x‚àà‚Ñùn‚à£xœÄ‚Å¢(1)‚â§‚Ä¶‚â§xœÄ‚Å¢(n)}subscriptùëÉùúãconditional-setùë•superscript‚Ñùùëõsubscriptùë•ùúã1‚Ä¶subscriptùë•ùúãùëõP_{\pi}=\{x\in\mathbb{R}^{n}\mid x_{\pi(1)}\leq\ldots\leq x_{\pi(n)}\}italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÄ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = { italic_x ‚àà blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚à£ italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÄ ( 1 ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â§ ‚Ä¶ ‚â§ italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÄ ( italic_n ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } for a permutation œÄ:[n]‚Üí[n]:ùúã‚Üídelimited-[]ùëõdelimited-[]ùëõ\pi\colon[n]\to[n]italic_œÄ : [ italic_n ] ‚Üí [ italic_n ]. There are exactly the n+1ùëõ1n+1italic_n + 1 indicator vectors {ùüôSi}i=0,‚Ä¶,nsubscriptsubscript1subscriptùëÜùëñùëñ0‚Ä¶ùëõ\{\mathds{1}_{S_{i}}\}_{i=0,\ldots,n}{ blackboard_1 start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 0 , ‚Ä¶ , italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT contained in PœÄsubscriptùëÉùúãP_{\pi}italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÄ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, where Si‚âî{œÄ‚Å¢(n+1‚àíi),‚Ä¶,œÄ‚Å¢(n)}‚âîsubscriptùëÜùëñùúãùëõ1ùëñ‚Ä¶ùúãùëõS_{i}\coloneqq\{\pi(n+1-i),\ldots,\pi(n)\}italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚âî { italic_œÄ ( italic_n + 1 - italic_i ) , ‚Ä¶ , italic_œÄ ( italic_n ) } for i‚àà[n]ùëñdelimited-[]ùëõi\in[n]italic_i ‚àà [ italic_n ] and S0‚âî‚àÖ‚âîsubscriptùëÜ0S_{0}\coloneqq\emptysetitalic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚âî ‚àÖ. Moreover, the vectors {ùüôSi}i=0,‚Ä¶,nsubscriptsubscript1subscriptùëÜùëñùëñ0‚Ä¶ùëõ\{\mathds{1}_{S_{i}}\}_{i=0,\ldots,n}{ blackboard_1 start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 0 , ‚Ä¶ , italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT are affinely independent and hence the values {f‚Å¢(ùüôSi)}i=0,‚Ä¶,nsubscriptùëìsubscript1subscriptùëÜùëñùëñ0‚Ä¶ùëõ\{f(\mathds{1}_{S_{i}})\}_{i=0,\ldots,n}{ italic_f ( blackboard_1 start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) } start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 0 , ‚Ä¶ , italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT uniquely determine the affine linear function f|PœÄevaluated-atùëìsubscriptùëÉùúãf|_{P_{\pi}}italic_f | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÄ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Therefore, fùëìfitalic_f is uniquely determined by {f‚Å¢(ùüôSi)}S‚äÜ[n]subscriptùëìsubscript1subscriptùëÜùëñùëÜdelimited-[]ùëõ\{f(\mathds{1}_{S_{i}})\}_{S\subseteq[n]}{ italic_f ( blackboard_1 start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) } start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_S ‚äÜ [ italic_n ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT.

Given any values {yS}S‚äÜ[n]subscriptsubscriptùë¶ùëÜùëÜdelimited-[]ùëõ\{y_{S}\}_{S\subseteq[n]}{ italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_S end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_S ‚äÜ [ italic_n ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, by the discussion above, there are unique affine linear maps f|PœÄevaluated-atùëìsubscriptùëÉùúãf|_{P_{\pi}}italic_f | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÄ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT yielding f|PœÄ‚Å¢(ùüôS)=ySevaluated-atùëìsubscriptùëÉùúãsubscript1ùëÜsubscriptùë¶ùëÜf|_{P_{\pi}}(\mathds{1}_{S})=y_{S}italic_f | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÄ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( blackboard_1 start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_S end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_S end_POSTSUBSCRIPT for all S‚äÜ[n]ùëÜdelimited-[]ùëõS\subseteq[n]italic_S ‚äÜ [ italic_n ] such that ùüôS‚ààPœÄsubscript1ùëÜsubscriptùëÉùúã\mathds{1}_{S}\in P_{\pi}blackboard_1 start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_S end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àà italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÄ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. It remains to show that the resulting function fùëìfitalic_f is well-defined on the facets ùí´n‚àí1superscriptùí´ùëõ1\mathcal{P}^{n-1}caligraphic_P start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. Any such facet is of the form

œÉœÄ,i={x‚àà‚Ñùn‚à£xœÄ‚Å¢(1)‚â§‚Ä¶‚â§xœÄ‚Å¢(i)=xœÄ‚Å¢(i+1)‚â§‚Ä¶‚â§xœÄ‚Å¢(n)},subscriptùúéùúãùëñconditional-setùë•superscript‚Ñùùëõsubscriptùë•ùúã1‚Ä¶subscriptùë•ùúãùëñsubscriptùë•ùúãùëñ1‚Ä¶subscriptùë•ùúãùëõ\sigma_{\pi,i}=\{x\in\mathbb{R}^{n}\mid x_{\pi(1)}\leq\ldots\leq x_{\pi(i)}=x_% {\pi(i+1)}\leq\ldots\leq x_{\pi(n)}\},italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÄ , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = { italic_x ‚àà blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚à£ italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÄ ( 1 ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â§ ‚Ä¶ ‚â§ italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÄ ( italic_i ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÄ ( italic_i + 1 ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â§ ‚Ä¶ ‚â§ italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÄ ( italic_n ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } ,

which is the intersection of PœÄsubscriptùëÉùúãP_{\pi}italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÄ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and PœÄ‚àò(i,i+1)subscriptùëÉùúãùëñùëñ1P_{\pi\circ(i,i+1)}italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÄ ‚àò ( italic_i , italic_i + 1 ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, where (i,i+1)ùëñùëñ1(i,i+1)( italic_i , italic_i + 1 ) denotes the transposition swapping iùëñiitalic_i and i+1ùëñ1i+1italic_i + 1. However, the indicator vectors {ùüôSi}i‚àà[n]‚àñ{i}subscriptsubscript1subscriptùëÜùëñùëñdelimited-[]ùëõùëñ\{\mathds{1}_{S_{i}}\}_{i\in[n]\setminus\{i\}}{ blackboard_1 start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i ‚àà [ italic_n ] ‚àñ { italic_i } end_POSTSUBSCRIPT contained in œÉœÄ,isubscriptùúéùúãùëñ\sigma_{\pi,i}italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÄ , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT are a subset of the indicator vectors contained in PœÄsubscriptùëÉùúãP_{\pi}italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÄ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and PœÄ‚àò(i,i+1)subscriptùëÉùúãùëñùëñ1P_{\pi\circ(i,i+1)}italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÄ ‚àò ( italic_i , italic_i + 1 ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Therefore, it holds that f|PœÄ‚Å¢(x)=f|PœÄ‚àò(i,i+1)‚Å¢(x)evaluated-atùëìsubscriptùëÉùúãùë•evaluated-atùëìsubscriptùëÉùúãùëñùëñ1ùë•f|_{P_{\pi}}(x)=f|_{P_{\pi\circ(i,i+1)}}(x)italic_f | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÄ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x ) = italic_f | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÄ ‚àò ( italic_i , italic_i + 1 ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x ) for all x‚ààœÉœÄ,iùë•subscriptùúéùúãùëñx\in\sigma_{\pi,i}italic_x ‚àà italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÄ , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT implying that fùëìfitalic_f is well-defined as a CPWL function. ‚àé

If we think this the other way around, starting with a set function FùêπFitalic_F, then f=Œ¶‚àí1‚Å¢(F)ùëìsuperscriptŒ¶1ùêπf=\Phi^{-1}(F)italic_f = roman_Œ¶ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_F ) is by definition a continuous extension of FùêπFitalic_F. It turns out that this particular extension is known as the Lov√°sz extension (Lov√°sz, 1983), as we argue below. The Lov√°sz extension is an important concept in the theory and practice of submodular function optimization as it provides a link between discrete submodular functions and continuous convex functions.

Definition D.3.

For a set function F:2[n]‚Üí‚Ñù:ùêπ‚Üísuperscript2delimited-[]ùëõ‚ÑùF\colon 2^{[n]}\to\mathbb{R}italic_F : 2 start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT [ italic_n ] end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Üí blackboard_R, the Lov√°sz extension f:‚Ñùn‚Üí‚Ñù:ùëì‚Üísuperscript‚Ñùùëõ‚Ñùf\colon\mathbb{R}^{n}\to\mathbb{R}italic_f : blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Üí blackboard_R is defined by f‚Å¢(x)=‚àëi=0nŒªi‚Å¢F‚Å¢(Si)ùëìùë•superscriptsubscriptùëñ0ùëõsubscriptùúÜùëñùêπsubscriptùëÜùëñf(x)=\sum_{i=0}^{n}\lambda_{i}F(S_{i})italic_f ( italic_x ) = ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_F ( italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ), where ‚àÖ=S0‚äÇS1‚äÇ‚Ä¶‚äÇSn=[n]subscriptùëÜ0subscriptùëÜ1‚Ä¶subscriptùëÜùëõdelimited-[]ùëõ\emptyset=S_{0}\subset S_{1}\subset\ldots\subset S_{n}=[n]‚àÖ = italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚äÇ italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚äÇ ‚Ä¶ ‚äÇ italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = [ italic_n ] is a chain such that ‚àëi=1nŒªi‚Å¢ùüôSi=xsuperscriptsubscriptùëñ1ùëõsubscriptùúÜùëñsubscript1subscriptùëÜùëñùë•\sum_{i=1}^{n}\lambda_{i}\mathds{1}_{S_{i}}=x‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_1 start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_x and Œªi‚â•0subscriptùúÜùëñ0\lambda_{i}\geq 0italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â• 0 for all i‚àà[n‚àí1]ùëñdelimited-[]ùëõ1i\in[n-1]italic_i ‚àà [ italic_n - 1 ] and Œª0=1‚àí‚àëi=1nŒªisubscriptùúÜ01superscriptsubscriptùëñ1ùëõsubscriptùúÜùëñ\lambda_{0}=1-\sum_{i=1}^{n}\lambda_{i}italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = 1 - ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT.

Remark D.4.

In many contexts in the literature, the Lov√°sz extension is only defined on the hypercube [0,1]nsuperscript01ùëõ[0,1]^{n}[ 0 , 1 ] start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. For our purposes, it is more convenient to omit this restriction, which is captured by the above definition.

The intuition of the Lov√°sz extension can already be seen in the proof of Proposition D.2: depending on the ordering of the components of an input vector xùë•xitalic_x, the Lov√°sz extension writes xùë•xitalic_x as an affine combination of indicator vectors ùüôSisubscript1subscriptùëÜùëñ\mathds{1}_{S_{i}}blackboard_1 start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, and uses the coefficients of the affine combination to compute the value f‚Å¢(x)ùëìùë•f(x)italic_f ( italic_x ). Following the intuition, we see in the next proposition that Œ¶‚àí1‚Å¢(F)superscriptŒ¶1ùêπ\Phi^{-1}(F)roman_Œ¶ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_F ) is actually the Lov√°sz extension of FùêπFitalic_F.

Proposition D.5.

For a set function F‚àà‚Ñ±nùêπsubscript‚Ñ±ùëõF\in\mathcal{F}_{n}italic_F ‚àà caligraphic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, the function f=Œ¶‚àí1‚Å¢(F)ùëìsuperscriptŒ¶1ùêπf=\Phi^{-1}(F)italic_f = roman_Œ¶ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_F ) is precisely the Lov√°sz extension of FùêπFitalic_F.

Proof.

By the definition of the Lov√°sz extension, it follows that it is compatible with ùí´ùí´\mathcal{P}caligraphic_P. Thus, the Lov√°sz extension is contained in ùí±ùí´subscriptùí±ùí´\mathcal{V}_{\mathcal{P}}caligraphic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Moreover, as it is an extension that fixes indicator vectors, it follows that Œ¶Œ¶\Phiroman_Œ¶ applied to the Lov√°sz extension of FùêπFitalic_F gives us back FùêπFitalic_F. As Œ¶Œ¶\Phiroman_Œ¶ is an isomorphism by Proposition D.2, the Lov√°sz extension must be exactly Œ¶‚àí1‚Å¢(F)superscriptŒ¶1ùêπ\Phi^{-1}(F)roman_Œ¶ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_F ). ‚àé

Definition D.6.

A set function F:2[n]‚Üí‚Ñù:ùêπ‚Üísuperscript2delimited-[]ùëõ‚ÑùF\colon 2^{[n]}\to\mathbb{R}italic_F : 2 start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT [ italic_n ] end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Üí blackboard_R is called submodular if

F‚Å¢(A)+F‚Å¢(B)‚â•F‚Å¢(A‚à™B)+F‚Å¢(A‚à©B)ùêπùê¥ùêπùêµùêπùê¥ùêµùêπùê¥ùêµF(A)+F(B)\geq F(A\cup B)+F(A\cap B)italic_F ( italic_A ) + italic_F ( italic_B ) ‚â• italic_F ( italic_A ‚à™ italic_B ) + italic_F ( italic_A ‚à© italic_B ) (2)

for all A,B‚äÜ[n]ùê¥ùêµdelimited-[]ùëõA,B\subseteq[n]italic_A , italic_B ‚äÜ [ italic_n ]. FùêπFitalic_F is called modular if equality holds for all A,B‚äÜ[n]ùê¥ùêµdelimited-[]ùëõA,B\subseteq[n]italic_A , italic_B ‚äÜ [ italic_n ].

The following well-known property is key to the insights of this section.

Proposition D.7 (Lov√°sz (1983)).

A set function FùêπFitalic_F is submodular if and only if its Lov√°sz extension f=Œ¶‚àí1‚Å¢(F)ùëìsuperscriptŒ¶1ùêπf=\Phi^{-1}(F)italic_f = roman_Œ¶ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_F ) is convex.

Applying our insights from Section 3 to the previous proposition, we obtain the following well-known statement.

Corollary D.8.

The set of submodular functions forms a polyhedral cone ùíÆ‚Å¢‚Ñ≥nùíÆsubscript‚Ñ≥ùëõ\mathcal{SM}_{n}caligraphic_S caligraphic_M start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT in the vector space ‚Ñ±nsubscript‚Ñ±ùëõ\mathcal{F}_{n}caligraphic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT.

In particular, we can specialize 1.1 in the setting of this section as follows.

Problem D.9.

Given a set function F‚àà‚Ñ±nùêπsubscript‚Ñ±ùëõF\in\mathcal{F}_{n}italic_F ‚àà caligraphic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, how to decompose it into a difference of submodular set functions such that their Lov√°sz extensions have as few pieces as possible?

Having a Lov√°sz extension with few pieces is desirable because it allows the submodular function to be stored and accessed efficiently during computational tasks. As D.9 is a special case of 1.1, we are able to translate our results from Section 3 to the setting of submodular functions.

Let ‚Ñ≥n‚äÜ‚Ñ±nsubscript‚Ñ≥ùëõsubscript‚Ñ±ùëõ\mathcal{M}_{n}\subseteq\mathcal{F}_{n}caligraphic_M start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚äÜ caligraphic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT be the vector space of modular functions, that is, set functions that satisfy equation 2 with equality. Note that a set function is modular if and only if its Lov√°sz extension is an affine function (Lov√°sz, 1983). Since for any M‚àà‚Ñ≥nùëÄsubscript‚Ñ≥ùëõM\in\mathcal{M}_{n}italic_M ‚àà caligraphic_M start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, a set function FùêπFitalic_F is submodular if and only if F+MùêπùëÄF+Mitalic_F + italic_M is submodular, we define the vector space ‚Ñ±¬Øn=‚Ñ±n/‚Ñ≥nsubscript¬Ø‚Ñ±ùëõsubscript‚Ñ±ùëõsubscript‚Ñ≥ùëõ\overline{\mathcal{F}}_{n}=\mathcal{F}_{n}/\mathcal{M}_{n}over¬Ø start_ARG caligraphic_F end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = caligraphic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / caligraphic_M start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT of set functions modulo modular functions. Furthermore, let ùíÆ‚Å¢‚Ñ≥¬Ønsubscript¬ØùíÆ‚Ñ≥ùëõ\overline{\mathcal{SM}}_{n}over¬Ø start_ARG caligraphic_S caligraphic_M end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT be the cone of submodular functions in this quotient. A decomposition (G,H)‚ààùíÆ‚Å¢‚Ñ≥¬Øn√óùíÆ‚Å¢‚Ñ≥¬Ønùê∫ùêªsubscript¬ØùíÆ‚Ñ≥ùëõsubscript¬ØùíÆ‚Ñ≥ùëõ(G,H)\in\overline{\mathcal{SM}}_{n}\times\overline{\mathcal{SM}}_{n}( italic_G , italic_H ) ‚àà over¬Ø start_ARG caligraphic_S caligraphic_M end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT √ó over¬Ø start_ARG caligraphic_S caligraphic_M end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT of a set function F‚àà‚Ñ±¬Ønùêπsubscript¬Ø‚Ñ±ùëõF\in\overline{\mathcal{F}}_{n}italic_F ‚àà over¬Ø start_ARG caligraphic_F end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is called irreducible if there does not exist a submodular function I‚ààùíÆ‚Å¢‚Ñ≥¬Øn‚àñ{0}ùêºsubscript¬ØùíÆ‚Ñ≥ùëõ0I\in\overline{\mathcal{SM}}_{n}\setminus\{0\}italic_I ‚àà over¬Ø start_ARG caligraphic_S caligraphic_M end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àñ { 0 } such that G‚àíIùê∫ùêºG-Iitalic_G - italic_I and H‚àíIùêªùêºH-Iitalic_H - italic_I are submodular. Since a set function M‚àà‚Ñ±nùëÄsubscript‚Ñ±ùëõM\in\mathcal{F}_{n}italic_M ‚àà caligraphic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is modular if and only if Œ¶‚àí1‚Å¢(M)superscriptŒ¶1ùëÄ\Phi^{-1}(M)roman_Œ¶ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_M ) is affine linear, the isomorphism Œ¶Œ¶\Phiroman_Œ¶ of Proposition D.2 descends to an isomorphism Œ¶¬Ø:‚Ñ±¬Øn‚Üíùí±¬Øùí´:¬ØŒ¶‚Üísubscript¬Ø‚Ñ±ùëõsubscript¬Øùí±ùí´\overline{\Phi}\colon\overline{\mathcal{F}}_{n}\to\overline{\mathcal{V}}_{% \mathcal{P}}over¬Ø start_ARG roman_Œ¶ end_ARG : over¬Ø start_ARG caligraphic_F end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚Üí over¬Ø start_ARG caligraphic_V end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT such that Œ¶¬Ø‚Å¢(ùíÆ‚Å¢‚Ñ≥¬Øn)=ùí±¬Øùí´+¬ØŒ¶subscript¬ØùíÆ‚Ñ≥ùëõsuperscriptsubscript¬Øùí±ùí´\overline{\Phi}(\overline{\mathcal{SM}}_{n})=\overline{\mathcal{V}}_{\mathcal{% P}}^{+}over¬Ø start_ARG roman_Œ¶ end_ARG ( over¬Ø start_ARG caligraphic_S caligraphic_M end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = over¬Ø start_ARG caligraphic_V end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT.

For a set function F‚àà‚Ñ±¬Ønùêπsubscript¬Ø‚Ñ±ùëõF\in\overline{\mathcal{F}}_{n}italic_F ‚àà over¬Ø start_ARG caligraphic_F end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, the set of decompositions ùíü‚Å¢(F)‚âî{(G,H)‚ààùíÆ‚Å¢‚Ñ≥¬Øn√óùíÆ‚Å¢‚Ñ≥¬Øn‚à£F=G‚àíH}‚âîùíüùêπconditional-setùê∫ùêªsubscript¬ØùíÆ‚Ñ≥ùëõsubscript¬ØùíÆ‚Ñ≥ùëõùêπùê∫ùêª\mathcal{D}(F)\coloneqq\{(G,H)\in\overline{\mathcal{SM}}_{n}\times\overline{% \mathcal{SM}}_{n}\mid F=G-H\}caligraphic_D ( italic_F ) ‚âî { ( italic_G , italic_H ) ‚àà over¬Ø start_ARG caligraphic_S caligraphic_M end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT √ó over¬Ø start_ARG caligraphic_S caligraphic_M end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚à£ italic_F = italic_G - italic_H } is a polyhedron.

Corollary D.10.

A decomposition (G,H)ùê∫ùêª(G,H)( italic_G , italic_H ) is irreducible if and only if (G,H)ùê∫ùêª(G,H)( italic_G , italic_H ) is contained in a bounded face of ùíü‚Å¢(‚Ñ±)ùíü‚Ñ±\mathcal{D}(\mathcal{F})caligraphic_D ( caligraphic_F ).

Proof.

The extension of Œ¶¬Ø¬ØŒ¶\overline{\Phi}over¬Ø start_ARG roman_Œ¶ end_ARG to the cartesian product Œ¶¬Ø√óŒ¶¬Ø:ùí±¬Øùí´√óùí±¬Øùí´‚Üí‚Ñ±¬Øn√ó‚Ñ±¬Øn:¬ØŒ¶¬ØŒ¶‚Üísubscript¬Øùí±ùí´subscript¬Øùí±ùí´subscript¬Ø‚Ñ±ùëõsubscript¬Ø‚Ñ±ùëõ\overline{\Phi}\times\overline{\Phi}\colon\overline{\mathcal{V}}_{\mathcal{P}}% \times\overline{\mathcal{V}}_{\mathcal{P}}\to\overline{\mathcal{F}}_{n}\times% \overline{\mathcal{F}}_{n}over¬Ø start_ARG roman_Œ¶ end_ARG √ó over¬Ø start_ARG roman_Œ¶ end_ARG : over¬Ø start_ARG caligraphic_V end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT √ó over¬Ø start_ARG caligraphic_V end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚Üí over¬Ø start_ARG caligraphic_F end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT √ó over¬Ø start_ARG caligraphic_F end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is an isomorphism. Then the statement follows from the fact that ùíü(F)=(Œ¶¬Ø√óŒ¶¬Ø)(ùíüùí´(Œ¶‚àí1(F))\mathcal{D}(F)=(\overline{\Phi}\times\overline{\Phi})(\mathcal{D}_{\mathcal{P}% }(\Phi^{-1}(F))caligraphic_D ( italic_F ) = ( over¬Ø start_ARG roman_Œ¶ end_ARG √ó over¬Ø start_ARG roman_Œ¶ end_ARG ) ( caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( roman_Œ¶ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_F ) ) and Theorem 3.8. ‚àé

Definition D.11.

For a submodular function F:2[n]‚Üí‚Ñù:ùêπ‚Üísuperscript2delimited-[]ùëõ‚ÑùF\colon 2^{[n]}\to\mathbb{R}italic_F : 2 start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT [ italic_n ] end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Üí blackboard_R, the base polytope B‚Å¢(F)ùêµùêπB(F)italic_B ( italic_F ) is defined as

B‚Å¢(F)‚âî{x‚àà‚Ñùn‚à£‚àëi‚ààSxi‚â§F‚Å¢(S)‚Å¢‚àÄS‚äÇ[n],‚àëi‚àà[n]xi=F‚Å¢([n])}.‚âîùêµùêπconditional-setùë•superscript‚Ñùùëõformulae-sequencesubscriptùëñùëÜsubscriptùë•ùëñùêπùëÜfor-allùëÜdelimited-[]ùëõsubscriptùëñdelimited-[]ùëõsubscriptùë•ùëñùêπdelimited-[]ùëõB(F)\coloneqq\{x\in\mathbb{R}^{n}\mid\sum_{i\in S}x_{i}\leq F(S)\,\forall S% \subset[n],\sum_{i\in[n]}x_{i}=F([n])\}.italic_B ( italic_F ) ‚âî { italic_x ‚àà blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚à£ ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i ‚àà italic_S end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚â§ italic_F ( italic_S ) ‚àÄ italic_S ‚äÇ [ italic_n ] , ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i ‚àà [ italic_n ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_F ( [ italic_n ] ) } .

Since we factored out modular functions, we can assume without loss of generality that a set function F‚àà‚Ñ±¬Ønùêπsubscript¬Ø‚Ñ±ùëõF\in\overline{\mathcal{F}}_{n}italic_F ‚àà over¬Ø start_ARG caligraphic_F end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is normalized, that is, F‚Å¢(‚àÖ)=0ùêπ0F(\emptyset)=0italic_F ( ‚àÖ ) = 0. In this case, f=Œ¶‚àí1‚Å¢(F)ùëìsuperscriptŒ¶1ùêπf=\Phi^{-1}(F)italic_f = roman_Œ¶ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_F ) is positively homogeneous. For the remaining chapter, we will assume all set functions to be normalized and all CPWL functions to be positively homogeneous. If FùêπFitalic_F is submodular, fùëìfitalic_f agrees with the support function of the base polytope B‚Å¢(F)ùêµùêπB(F)italic_B ( italic_F ), and therefore B‚Å¢(F)ùêµùêπB(F)italic_B ( italic_F ) is the Newton polytope Newt‚Å°(f)Newtùëì\operatorname{Newt}(f)roman_Newt ( italic_f ) of the Lov√°sz extension fùëìfitalic_f (see e.g. Aguiar & Ardila (2017) Theorem 12.3.). The Newton polytopes of functions that differ by a linear map are a translation of each other and modular functions correspond to linear functions. Hence, if we denote by ‚Ñ¨¬Ønsubscript¬Ø‚Ñ¨ùëõ\overline{\mathcal{B}}_{n}over¬Ø start_ARG caligraphic_B end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT the set of base polytopes in ‚Ñùnsuperscript‚Ñùùëõ\mathbb{R}^{n}blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT modulo translation, the maps B:‚Ñ±¬Øn‚Üí‚Ñ¨¬Øn,F‚Ü¶B‚Å¢(F):ùêµformulae-sequence‚Üísubscript¬Ø‚Ñ±ùëõsubscript¬Ø‚Ñ¨ùëõmaps-toùêπùêµùêπB\colon\overline{\mathcal{F}}_{n}\to\overline{\mathcal{B}}_{n},F\mapsto B(F)italic_B : over¬Ø start_ARG caligraphic_F end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚Üí over¬Ø start_ARG caligraphic_B end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_F ‚Ü¶ italic_B ( italic_F ) and Newt:ùí±¬Øùí´‚Üí‚Ñ¨¬Øn,f‚Ü¶Newt‚Å°(f):Newtformulae-sequence‚Üísubscript¬Øùí±ùí´subscript¬Ø‚Ñ¨ùëõmaps-toùëìNewtùëì\operatorname{Newt}\colon\overline{\mathcal{V}}_{\mathcal{P}}\to\overline{% \mathcal{B}}_{n},f\mapsto\operatorname{Newt}(f)roman_Newt : over¬Ø start_ARG caligraphic_V end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚Üí over¬Ø start_ARG caligraphic_B end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_f ‚Ü¶ roman_Newt ( italic_f ) are well defined and we obtain the following diagramm:

In this setting, we call a decomposition (G,H)‚ààùíü‚Å¢(F)ùê∫ùêªùíüùêπ(G,H)\in\mathcal{D}(F)( italic_G , italic_H ) ‚àà caligraphic_D ( italic_F ) minimal, if it is not dominated by any other decomposition, that is, if there is no other decomposition (G‚Ä≤,H‚Ä≤)‚ààùíü‚Å¢(F)superscriptùê∫‚Ä≤superscriptùêª‚Ä≤ùíüùêπ(G^{\prime},H^{\prime})\in\mathcal{D}(F)( italic_G start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ‚àà caligraphic_D ( italic_F ) where B‚Å¢(G‚Ä≤)ùêµsuperscriptùê∫‚Ä≤B(G^{\prime})italic_B ( italic_G start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) has at most as many vertices as B‚Å¢(G)ùêµùê∫B(G)italic_B ( italic_G ), B‚Å¢(H‚Ä≤)ùêµsuperscriptùêª‚Ä≤B(H^{\prime})italic_B ( italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) has at most as many vertices as B‚Å¢(H)ùêµùêªB(H)italic_B ( italic_H ), and one of the two has strictly fewer vertices.

For a tuple of submodular functions (G,H)‚ààùíÆ‚Å¢‚Ñ≥¬Ø√óùíÆ‚Å¢‚Ñ≥¬Øùê∫ùêª¬ØùíÆ‚Ñ≥¬ØùíÆ‚Ñ≥(G,H)\in\overline{\mathcal{SM}}\times\overline{\mathcal{SM}}( italic_G , italic_H ) ‚àà over¬Ø start_ARG caligraphic_S caligraphic_M end_ARG √ó over¬Ø start_ARG caligraphic_S caligraphic_M end_ARG, let (ùí´G,ùí´H)subscriptùí´ùê∫subscriptùí´ùêª(\mathcal{P}_{G},\mathcal{P}_{H})( caligraphic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , caligraphic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_H end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) be the tuple of the normal fans of the base polytopes B‚Å¢(G)ùêµùê∫B(G)italic_B ( italic_G ) and B‚Å¢(H)ùêµùêªB(H)italic_B ( italic_H ). A decomposition (G‚Ä≤,H‚Ä≤)‚ààùíü‚Å¢(F)superscriptùê∫‚Ä≤superscriptùêª‚Ä≤ùíüùêπ(G^{\prime},H^{\prime})\in\mathcal{D}(F)( italic_G start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ‚àà caligraphic_D ( italic_F ) is called a (non-trivial) coarsening of (G,H)‚ààùíü‚Å¢(F)ùê∫ùêªùíüùêπ(G,H)\in\mathcal{D}(F)( italic_G , italic_H ) ‚àà caligraphic_D ( italic_F ) if ùí´G‚Ä≤subscriptùí´superscriptùê∫‚Ä≤\mathcal{P}_{G^{\prime}}caligraphic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and ùí´H‚Ä≤subscriptùí´superscriptùêª‚Ä≤\mathcal{P}_{H^{\prime}}caligraphic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT are coarsenings of ùí´Gsubscriptùí´ùê∫\mathcal{P}_{G}caligraphic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and ùí´Hsubscriptùí´ùêª\mathcal{P}_{H}caligraphic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_H end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, respectively (and at least one of them is a non-trivial coarsening).

Corollary D.12.

(G,H)‚ààùíü‚Å¢(F)ùê∫ùêªùíüùêπ(G,H)\in\mathcal{D}(F)( italic_G , italic_H ) ‚àà caligraphic_D ( italic_F ) is a vertex if and only if there is no non-trivial coarsening of (G,H)ùê∫ùêª(G,H)( italic_G , italic_H ).

Proof.

Since g=Œ¶‚àí1‚Å¢(G)ùëîsuperscriptŒ¶1ùê∫g=\Phi^{-1}(G)italic_g = roman_Œ¶ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_G ) and h=Œ¶‚àí1‚Å¢(H)‚ÑésuperscriptŒ¶1ùêªh=\Phi^{-1}(H)italic_h = roman_Œ¶ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_H ) are the support functions of the base polytopes B‚Å¢(G)ùêµùê∫B(G)italic_B ( italic_G ) respectively B‚Å¢(H)ùêµùêªB(H)italic_B ( italic_H ), the tuple of normal fans (ùí´G,ùí´H)subscriptùí´ùê∫subscriptùí´ùêª(\mathcal{P}_{G},\mathcal{P}_{H})( caligraphic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , caligraphic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_H end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) agrees with the tuple (ùí´g,ùí´h)subscriptùí´ùëîsubscriptùí´‚Ñé(\mathcal{P}_{g},\mathcal{P}_{h})( caligraphic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_g end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , caligraphic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_h end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) of the unique coarsest polyhedral complexes compatible with gùëîgitalic_g and h‚Ñéhitalic_h. Hence by Theorem 3.11, there is no non-trivial coarsening of (G,H)ùê∫ùêª(G,H)( italic_G , italic_H ) if and only if (g,h)ùëî‚Ñé(g,h)( italic_g , italic_h ) is a vertex of ùíüùí´‚Å¢(f)subscriptùíüùí´ùëì\mathcal{D}_{\mathcal{P}}(f)caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_f ) which is the case if and only if (G,H)ùê∫ùêª(G,H)( italic_G , italic_H ) is a vertex of ùíü‚Å¢(F)ùíüùêπ\mathcal{D}(F)caligraphic_D ( italic_F ). ‚àé

Corollary D.13.

For a normalized set function F‚àà‚Ñ±¬Ønùêπsubscript¬Ø‚Ñ±ùëõF\in\overline{\mathcal{F}}_{n}italic_F ‚àà over¬Ø start_ARG caligraphic_F end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, a minimal decomposition of FùêπFitalic_F is a vertex of ùíü‚Å¢(F)ùíüùêπ\mathcal{D}(F)caligraphic_D ( italic_F ).

Proof.

If (G,H)ùê∫ùêª(G,H)( italic_G , italic_H ) is not a vertex, then there is a coarsening (G‚Ä≤,H‚Ä≤)‚ààùíü‚Å¢(F)superscriptùê∫‚Ä≤superscriptùêª‚Ä≤ùíüùêπ(G^{\prime},H^{\prime})\in\mathcal{D}(F)( italic_G start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ‚àà caligraphic_D ( italic_F ) of (G,H)ùê∫ùêª(G,H)( italic_G , italic_H ) implying that (G‚Ä≤,H‚Ä≤)superscriptùê∫‚Ä≤superscriptùêª‚Ä≤(G^{\prime},H^{\prime})( italic_G start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) dominates (G,H)ùê∫ùêª(G,H)( italic_G , italic_H ). ‚àé

The following example shows that the Lov√°sz extensions of cut functions are hyperplane functions thus admit a unique minimal decomposition into submodular functions, which are themselves cut functions. In particular, the Lov√°sz extensions of the decomposition have at most as many pieces as the Lov√°sz extensions of the original cut function.

Example D.14 (Minimal decompositions of cut functions).

Let G=(V,E)ùê∫ùëâùê∏G=(V,E)italic_G = ( italic_V , italic_E ) be a graph where V=[n]ùëâdelimited-[]ùëõV=[n]italic_V = [ italic_n ] and c:E‚Üí‚Ñù:ùëê‚Üíùê∏‚Ñùc\colon E\to\mathbb{R}italic_c : italic_E ‚Üí blackboard_R a weight function on the edges. Let F‚àà‚Ñ±nùêπsubscript‚Ñ±ùëõF\in\mathcal{F}_{n}italic_F ‚àà caligraphic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT be the cut function given by F‚Å¢(S)=‚àë{u,v}‚ààŒ¥‚Å¢(S)c‚Å¢({u,v})ùêπùëÜsubscriptùë¢ùë£ùõøùëÜùëêùë¢ùë£F(S)=\sum_{\{u,v\}\in\delta(S)}c(\{u,v\})italic_F ( italic_S ) = ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT { italic_u , italic_v } ‚àà italic_Œ¥ ( italic_S ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c ( { italic_u , italic_v } ), where Œ¥‚Å¢(S)‚âî{{u,v}‚ààE‚à£u‚ààS,v‚ààV‚àñS}‚âîùõøùëÜconditional-setùë¢ùë£ùê∏formulae-sequenceùë¢ùëÜùë£ùëâùëÜ\delta(S)\coloneqq\{\{u,v\}\in E\mid u\in S,v\in V\setminus S\}italic_Œ¥ ( italic_S ) ‚âî { { italic_u , italic_v } ‚àà italic_E ‚à£ italic_u ‚àà italic_S , italic_v ‚àà italic_V ‚àñ italic_S }. The function f‚âîŒ¶‚àí1‚Å¢(F)‚ààùí±ùí´‚âîùëìsuperscriptŒ¶1ùêπsubscriptùí±ùí´f\coloneqq\Phi^{-1}(F)\in\mathcal{V}_{\mathcal{P}}italic_f ‚âî roman_Œ¶ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_F ) ‚àà caligraphic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is given by f‚Å¢(x)=‚àë{u,v}‚ààEc‚Å¢({u,v})‚ãÖfu,v‚Å¢(x)ùëìùë•subscriptùë¢ùë£ùê∏‚ãÖùëêùë¢ùë£subscriptùëìùë¢ùë£ùë•f(x)=\sum_{\{u,v\}\in E}c(\{u,v\})\cdot f_{u,v}(x)italic_f ( italic_x ) = ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT { italic_u , italic_v } ‚àà italic_E end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c ( { italic_u , italic_v } ) ‚ãÖ italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_u , italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x ), where fu,v‚Å¢(x)=max‚Å°{xu‚àíxv,xv‚àíxu}subscriptùëìùë¢ùë£ùë•subscriptùë•ùë¢subscriptùë•ùë£subscriptùë•ùë£subscriptùë•ùë¢f_{u,v}(x)=\max\{x_{u}-x_{v},x_{v}-x_{u}\}italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_u , italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x ) = roman_max { italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_u end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_u end_POSTSUBSCRIPT }. To see this, first note that f‚ààùí±ùí´ùëìsubscriptùí±ùí´f\in\mathcal{V}_{\mathcal{P}}italic_f ‚àà caligraphic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Thus, it suffices to check that F‚Å¢(S)=f‚Å¢(ùüôS)ùêπùëÜùëìsubscript1ùëÜF(S)=f(\mathds{1}_{S})italic_F ( italic_S ) = italic_f ( blackboard_1 start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_S end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) for all S‚äÜ[n]ùëÜdelimited-[]ùëõS\subseteq[n]italic_S ‚äÜ [ italic_n ], which follows due to the observation that

fu,v‚Å¢(ùüôS)={1{u,v}‚ààŒ¥‚Å¢(S)0{u,v}‚àâŒ¥‚Å¢(S)subscriptùëìùë¢ùë£subscript1ùëÜcases1ùë¢ùë£ùõøùëÜ0ùë¢ùë£ùõøùëÜf_{u,v}(\mathds{1}_{S})=\begin{cases}1&\{u,v\}\in\delta(S)\\ 0&\{u,v\}\not\in\delta(S)\end{cases}italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_u , italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( blackboard_1 start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_S end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = { start_ROW start_CELL 1 end_CELL start_CELL { italic_u , italic_v } ‚àà italic_Œ¥ ( italic_S ) end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL 0 end_CELL start_CELL { italic_u , italic_v } ‚àâ italic_Œ¥ ( italic_S ) end_CELL end_ROW

Hence, Example A.2 implies that the functions

g=‚àëc‚Å¢({u,v})>0c‚Å¢({u,v})‚ãÖfu,v‚Å¢ and ‚Å¢h=‚àëc‚Å¢({u,v})<0c‚Å¢({u,v})‚ãÖfu,vùëîsubscriptùëêùë¢ùë£0‚ãÖùëêùë¢ùë£subscriptùëìùë¢ùë£ and ‚Ñésubscriptùëêùë¢ùë£0‚ãÖùëêùë¢ùë£subscriptùëìùë¢ùë£g=\sum_{c(\{u,v\})>0}c(\{u,v\})\cdot f_{u,v}\text{ and }h=\sum_{c(\{u,v\})<0}c% (\{u,v\})\cdot f_{u,v}italic_g = ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c ( { italic_u , italic_v } ) > 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c ( { italic_u , italic_v } ) ‚ãÖ italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_u , italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and italic_h = ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c ( { italic_u , italic_v } ) < 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c ( { italic_u , italic_v } ) ‚ãÖ italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_u , italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT

form the unique minimal decomposition of fùëìfitalic_f. Thus, G=Œ¶‚Å¢(g)ùê∫Œ¶ùëîG=\Phi(g)italic_G = roman_Œ¶ ( italic_g ) and H=Œ¶‚Å¢(h)ùêªŒ¶‚ÑéH=\Phi(h)italic_H = roman_Œ¶ ( italic_h ), the submodular functions given by

G‚Å¢(S)=‚àë{u,v}‚ààŒ¥‚Å¢(S)c‚Å¢({u,v})>0c‚Å¢({u,v})‚Å¢ and ‚Å¢H‚Å¢(S)=‚àë{u,v}‚ààŒ¥‚Å¢(S)c‚Å¢({u,v})<0c‚Å¢({u,v})ùê∫ùëÜsubscriptùë¢ùë£ùõøùëÜùëêùë¢ùë£0ùëêùë¢ùë£ and ùêªùëÜsubscriptùë¢ùë£ùõøùëÜùëêùë¢ùë£0ùëêùë¢ùë£G(S)=\sum\limits_{\begin{subarray}{c}\{u,v\}\in\delta(S)\\ c(\{u,v\})>0\end{subarray}}c(\{u,v\})\text{ and }H(S)=\sum\limits_{\begin{% subarray}{c}\{u,v\}\in\delta(S)\\ c(\{u,v\})<0\end{subarray}}c(\{u,v\})italic_G ( italic_S ) = ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_ARG start_ROW start_CELL { italic_u , italic_v } ‚àà italic_Œ¥ ( italic_S ) end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL italic_c ( { italic_u , italic_v } ) > 0 end_CELL end_ROW end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c ( { italic_u , italic_v } ) and italic_H ( italic_S ) = ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_ARG start_ROW start_CELL { italic_u , italic_v } ‚àà italic_Œ¥ ( italic_S ) end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL italic_c ( { italic_u , italic_v } ) < 0 end_CELL end_ROW end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c ( { italic_u , italic_v } )

are the unique minimal decompositions of FùêπFitalic_F into submodular functions.

Appendix E Proofs

E.1 Proof of Lemma 3.1

Proof.

Let f,gùëìùëîf,gitalic_f , italic_g be CPWL functions which are compatible with ùí´ùí´\mathcal{P}caligraphic_P, and Œª,Œº‚àà‚ÑùùúÜùúá‚Ñù\lambda,\mu\in\mathbb{R}italic_Œª , italic_Œº ‚àà blackboard_R. Then for any P‚ààùí´nùëÉsubscriptùí´ùëõP\in\mathcal{P}_{n}italic_P ‚àà caligraphic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT holds (Œª‚Å¢f+Œº‚Å¢g)|P=Œª‚Å¢f|P+Œº‚Å¢g|Pevaluated-atùúÜùëìùúáùëîùëÉevaluated-atùúÜùëìùëÉevaluated-atùúáùëîùëÉ(\lambda f+\mu g)|_{P}=\lambda f|_{P}+\mu g|_{P}( italic_Œª italic_f + italic_Œº italic_g ) | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_Œª italic_f | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_Œº italic_g | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, which is an affine function restricted to PùëÉPitalic_P. Thus, the set ùí±ùí´subscriptùí±ùí´\mathcal{V}_{\mathcal{P}}caligraphic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT of CPWL functions compatible with ùí´ùí´\mathcal{P}caligraphic_P forms a linear subspace of the space of continuous functions. ‚àé

E.2 Proof of Lemma 3.2

Proof.

Let f‚ààùí±ùí´ùëìsubscriptùí±ùí´f\in\mathcal{V}_{\mathcal{P}}italic_f ‚àà caligraphic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Since ùí´ùí´\mathcal{P}caligraphic_P is a complete polyhedral complex, for every œÉ‚ààùí´n‚àí1ùúésuperscriptùí´ùëõ1\sigma\in\mathcal{P}^{n-1}italic_œÉ ‚àà caligraphic_P start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, there are P,Q‚ààùí´nùëÉùëÑsuperscriptùí´ùëõP,Q\in\mathcal{P}^{n}italic_P , italic_Q ‚àà caligraphic_P start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT such that œÉ=P‚à©QùúéùëÉùëÑ\sigma=P\cap Qitalic_œÉ = italic_P ‚à© italic_Q. Let aP,aQ‚àà‚ÑùnsubscriptùëéùëÉsubscriptùëéùëÑsuperscript‚Ñùùëõa_{P},a_{Q}\in\mathbb{R}^{n}italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àà blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and bP,bQ‚àà‚ÑùsubscriptùëèùëÉsubscriptùëèùëÑ‚Ñùb_{P},b_{Q}\in\mathbb{R}italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àà blackboard_R such that f|P‚Å¢(x)=‚ü®aP,x‚ü©+bPevaluated-atùëìùëÉùë•subscriptùëéùëÉùë•subscriptùëèùëÉf|_{P}(x)=\langle a_{P},x\rangle+b_{P}italic_f | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x ) = ‚ü® italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_x ‚ü© + italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and f|Q‚Å¢(x)=‚ü®aQ,x‚ü©+bQevaluated-atùëìùëÑùë•subscriptùëéùëÑùë•subscriptùëèùëÑf|_{Q}(x)=\langle a_{Q},x\rangle+b_{Q}italic_f | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x ) = ‚ü® italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_x ‚ü© + italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Consider the linear map œï:ùí±ùí´‚Üíùí≤ùí´:italic-œï‚Üísubscriptùí±ùí´subscriptùí≤ùí´\phi\colon\mathcal{V}_{\mathcal{P}}\to\mathcal{W}_{\mathcal{P}}italic_œï : caligraphic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚Üí caligraphic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT given by

wf‚Å¢(œÉ)‚âî‚ü®eP/œÉ,aP‚ü©+‚ü®eQ/œÉ,aQ‚ü©=‚ü®eP/œÉ,aP‚àíaQ‚ü©.‚âîsubscriptùë§ùëìùúésubscriptùëíùëÉùúésubscriptùëéùëÉsubscriptùëíùëÑùúésubscriptùëéùëÑsubscriptùëíùëÉùúésubscriptùëéùëÉsubscriptùëéùëÑw_{f}(\sigma)\coloneqq\langle e_{P/\sigma},a_{P}\rangle+\langle e_{Q/\sigma},a% _{Q}\rangle=\langle e_{P/\sigma},a_{P}-a_{Q}\rangle.italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_œÉ ) ‚âî ‚ü® italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P / italic_œÉ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ü© + ‚ü® italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q / italic_œÉ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ü© = ‚ü® italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P / italic_œÉ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ü© .

Note that if fùëìfitalic_f is locally convex at œÉùúé\sigmaitalic_œÉ, then ‚ü®eP/œÉ,aP‚àíaQ‚ü©=‚ÄñaP‚àíaQ‚Äñ2subscriptùëíùëÉùúésubscriptùëéùëÉsubscriptùëéùëÑsubscriptnormsubscriptùëéùëÉsubscriptùëéùëÑ2\langle e_{P/\sigma},a_{P}-a_{Q}\rangle=\|a_{P}-a_{Q}\|_{2}‚ü® italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P / italic_œÉ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ü© = ‚à• italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚à• start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and if fùëìfitalic_f is locally concave at œÉùúé\sigmaitalic_œÉ, then ‚ü®eP/œÉ,aP‚àíaQ‚ü©=‚àí‚ÄñaP‚àíaQ‚Äñ2subscriptùëíùëÉùúésubscriptùëéùëÉsubscriptùëéùëÑsubscriptnormsubscriptùëéùëÉsubscriptùëéùëÑ2\langle e_{P/\sigma},a_{P}-a_{Q}\rangle=-\|a_{P}-a_{Q}\|_{2}‚ü® italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P / italic_œÉ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ü© = - ‚à• italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚à• start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. The proof proceeds analogously to the case where fùëìfitalic_f has only convex breakpoints and the coefficients of the affine maps are rational. In this case, the lemma follows from the structure theorem of tropical geometry. See Maclagan & Sturmfels (2015) Proposition 3.3.2 for a proof that wf‚ààùí≤ùí´subscriptùë§ùëìsubscriptùí≤ùí´w_{f}\in\mathcal{W}_{\mathcal{P}}italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àà caligraphic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and Maclagan & Sturmfels (2015) Proposition 3.3.10 for a proof that œïitalic-œï\phiitalic_œï is surjective. Here, we present an adjusted proof (to not necessarily convex functions and irrational coefficients). First, we check that wf‚ààùí≤ùí´subscriptùë§ùëìsubscriptùí≤ùí´w_{f}\in\mathcal{W}_{\mathcal{P}}italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àà caligraphic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Let œÑ‚ààùí´n‚àí2ùúèsuperscriptùí´ùëõ2\tau\in\mathcal{P}^{n-2}italic_œÑ ‚àà caligraphic_P start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n - 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and {P1,‚Ä¶,Pm}=starùí´‚Å°(œÑ)‚à©ùí´nsubscriptùëÉ1‚Ä¶subscriptùëÉùëösubscriptstarùí´ùúèsuperscriptùí´ùëõ\{P_{1},\ldots,P_{m}\}=\operatorname{star}_{\mathcal{P}}(\tau)\cap\mathcal{P}^% {n}{ italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ‚Ä¶ , italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } = roman_star start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_œÑ ) ‚à© caligraphic_P start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and {œÉ1,‚Ä¶,œÉm}=starùí´‚Å°(œÑ)‚à©ùí´n‚àí1subscriptùúé1‚Ä¶subscriptùúéùëösubscriptstarùí´ùúèsuperscriptùí´ùëõ1\{\sigma_{1},\ldots,\sigma_{m}\}=\operatorname{star}_{\mathcal{P}}(\tau)\cap% \mathcal{P}^{n-1}{ italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ‚Ä¶ , italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } = roman_star start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_œÑ ) ‚à© caligraphic_P start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT be ordered in a cyclic way, that is, Pi‚à©Pi+1=œÉisubscriptùëÉùëñsubscriptùëÉùëñ1subscriptùúéùëñP_{i}\cap P_{i+1}=\sigma_{i}italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚à© italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT for i‚àà[m]ùëñdelimited-[]ùëöi\in[m]italic_i ‚àà [ italic_m ], where Pm+1=P1subscriptùëÉùëö1subscriptùëÉ1P_{m+1}=P_{1}italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Note that, since fùëìfitalic_f is continuous, we have that aPi‚àíaPi+1‚ààspan‚Å°(ePi/œÉi)subscriptùëésubscriptùëÉùëñsubscriptùëésubscriptùëÉùëñ1spansubscriptùëísubscriptùëÉùëñsubscriptùúéùëña_{P_{i}}-a_{P_{i+1}}\in\operatorname{span}(e_{P_{i}/\sigma_{i}})italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àà roman_span ( italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ). The linear map TœÑ:aff(œÑ)‚üÇ‚Üíaff(œÑ)‚üÇT_{\tau}\colon\operatorname{aff}(\tau)^{\perp}\to\operatorname{aff}(\tau)^{\perp}italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÑ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT : roman_aff ( italic_œÑ ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚üÇ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Üí roman_aff ( italic_œÑ ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚üÇ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT satisfying TœÑ‚Å¢(ePi/œÉi)=eœÉi/œÑsubscriptùëáùúèsubscriptùëísubscriptùëÉùëñsubscriptùúéùëñsubscriptùëísubscriptùúéùëñùúèT_{\tau}(e_{P_{i}/\sigma_{i}})=e_{\sigma_{i}/\tau}italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÑ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_œÑ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT (given by a rotation matrix) is an automorphism, implying that

‚àëœÉ‚äÉœÑœÉ‚ààùí´n‚àí1wf‚Å¢(œÉ)‚ãÖeœÉ/œÑsubscriptùúèùúéùúésuperscriptùí´ùëõ1‚ãÖsubscriptùë§ùëìùúésubscriptùëíùúéùúè\displaystyle\sum_{\begin{subarray}{c}\sigma\supset\tau\\ \sigma\in\mathcal{P}^{n-1}\end{subarray}}w_{f}(\sigma)\cdot e_{\sigma/\tau}‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_ARG start_ROW start_CELL italic_œÉ ‚äÉ italic_œÑ end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL italic_œÉ ‚àà caligraphic_P start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_CELL end_ROW end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_œÉ ) ‚ãÖ italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÉ / italic_œÑ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT =‚àëi=1mwf‚Å¢(œÉi)‚ãÖTœÑ‚Å¢(ePi/œÉi)absentsuperscriptsubscriptùëñ1ùëö‚ãÖsubscriptùë§ùëìsubscriptùúéùëñsubscriptùëáùúèsubscriptùëísubscriptùëÉùëñsubscriptùúéùëñ\displaystyle=\sum_{i=1}^{m}w_{f}(\sigma_{i})\cdot T_{\tau}(e_{P_{i}/\sigma_{i% }})= ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ‚ãÖ italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÑ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT )
=TœÑ‚Å¢(‚àëi=1m‚ü®ePi/œÉi,aPi‚àíaPi+1‚ü©‚ãÖePi/œÉi)absentsubscriptùëáùúèsuperscriptsubscriptùëñ1ùëö‚ãÖsubscriptùëísubscriptùëÉùëñsubscriptùúéùëñsubscriptùëésubscriptùëÉùëñsubscriptùëésubscriptùëÉùëñ1subscriptùëísubscriptùëÉùëñsubscriptùúéùëñ\displaystyle=T_{\tau}\left(\sum_{i=1}^{m}\langle e_{P_{i}/\sigma_{i}},a_{P_{i% }}-{a_{P_{i+1}}}\rangle\cdot e_{P_{i}/\sigma_{i}}\right)= italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÑ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚ü® italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ü© ‚ãÖ italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT )
=TœÑ‚Å¢(‚àëi=1m‚ü®ePi/œÉi,ePi/œÉi‚ü©‚ãÖ(aPi‚àíaPi+1))absentsubscriptùëáùúèsuperscriptsubscriptùëñ1ùëö‚ãÖsubscriptùëísubscriptùëÉùëñsubscriptùúéùëñsubscriptùëísubscriptùëÉùëñsubscriptùúéùëñsubscriptùëésubscriptùëÉùëñsubscriptùëésubscriptùëÉùëñ1\displaystyle=T_{\tau}\left(\sum_{i=1}^{m}\langle e_{P_{i}/\sigma_{i}},e_{P_{i% }/\sigma_{i}}\rangle\cdot(a_{P_{i}}-{a_{P_{i+1}}})\right)= italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÑ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚ü® italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ü© ‚ãÖ ( italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) )
=TœÑ‚Å¢(0)=0absentsubscriptùëáùúè00\displaystyle=T_{\tau}(0)=0= italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÑ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( 0 ) = 0

We proceed by showing that the map œïitalic-œï\phiitalic_œï is surjective and its kernel is precisely Aff‚Å°(‚Ñùn)Affsuperscript‚Ñùùëõ\operatorname{Aff}(\mathbb{R}^{n})roman_Aff ( blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) and therefore, it induces an isomorphism between ùí±¬Øùí´subscript¬Øùí±ùí´\overline{\mathcal{V}}_{\mathcal{P}}over¬Ø start_ARG caligraphic_V end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and ùí≤ùí´subscriptùí≤ùí´\mathcal{W}_{\mathcal{P}}caligraphic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT.

The kernel of œïitalic-œï\phiitalic_œï is Aff‚Å°(‚Ñùn)Affsuperscript‚Ñùùëõ\operatorname{Aff}(\mathbb{R}^{n})roman_Aff ( blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) since wf‚Å¢(œÉ)=‚ü®eP/œÉ,aP‚ü©+‚ü®eQ/œÉ,aQ‚ü©=‚ü®eP/œÉ,aP‚àíaQ‚ü©=0subscriptùë§ùëìùúésubscriptùëíùëÉùúésubscriptùëéùëÉsubscriptùëíùëÑùúésubscriptùëéùëÑsubscriptùëíùëÉùúésubscriptùëéùëÉsubscriptùëéùëÑ0w_{f}(\sigma)=\langle e_{P/\sigma},a_{P}\rangle+\langle e_{Q/\sigma},a_{Q}% \rangle=\langle e_{P/\sigma},a_{P}-a_{Q}\rangle=0italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_œÉ ) = ‚ü® italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P / italic_œÉ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ü© + ‚ü® italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q / italic_œÉ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ü© = ‚ü® italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P / italic_œÉ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ü© = 0 if and only if aP‚àíaQ=0subscriptùëéùëÉsubscriptùëéùëÑ0a_{P}-a_{Q}=0italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = 0 due to the fact that aP‚àíaQ‚ààspan‚Å°(eP/œÉ)subscriptùëéùëÉsubscriptùëéùëÑspansubscriptùëíùëÉùúéa_{P}-a_{Q}\in\operatorname{span}(e_{P/\sigma})italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àà roman_span ( italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P / italic_œÉ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ). Due to the continuity of fùëìfitalic_f, this also implies that bP=bQsubscriptùëèùëÉsubscriptùëèùëÑb_{P}=b_{Q}italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and hence f|Q=f|Pevaluated-atùëìùëÑevaluated-atùëìùëÉf|_{Q}=f|_{P}italic_f | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_f | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and therefore the map fùëìfitalic_f is affine linear.

To show surjectivity, let w‚ààùí≤ùí´ùë§subscriptùí≤ùí´w\in\mathcal{W}_{\mathcal{P}}italic_w ‚àà caligraphic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. We aim to find an f‚ààùí±ùí´ùëìsubscriptùí±ùí´f\in\mathcal{V}_{\mathcal{P}}italic_f ‚àà caligraphic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT such that w=œï‚Å¢(f)ùë§italic-œïùëìw=\phi(f)italic_w = italic_œï ( italic_f ). Let ùí´n={P1,‚Ä¶‚Å¢Pk}superscriptùí´ùëõsubscriptùëÉ1‚Ä¶subscriptùëÉùëò\mathcal{P}^{n}=\{P_{1},\ldots P_{k}\}caligraphic_P start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = { italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ‚Ä¶ italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } and for P‚ààùí´n,œÉ‚ààùí´n‚àí1formulae-sequenceùëÉsuperscriptùí´ùëõùúésuperscriptùí´ùëõ1P\in\mathcal{P}^{n},\sigma\in\mathcal{P}^{n-1}italic_P ‚àà caligraphic_P start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_œÉ ‚àà caligraphic_P start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, let bP/œÉ‚àà‚ÑùsubscriptùëèùëÉùúé‚Ñùb_{P/\sigma}\in\mathbb{R}italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P / italic_œÉ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àà blackboard_R such that œÉùúé\sigmaitalic_œÉ is contained in the hyperplane {x‚àà‚Ñùn‚à£‚ü®eP/œÉ,x‚ü©+bP/œÉ=0}conditional-setùë•superscript‚ÑùùëõsubscriptùëíùëÉùúéùë•subscriptùëèùëÉùúé0\{x\in\mathbb{R}^{n}\mid\langle e_{P/\sigma},x\rangle+b_{P/\sigma}=0\}{ italic_x ‚àà blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚à£ ‚ü® italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P / italic_œÉ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_x ‚ü© + italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P / italic_œÉ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = 0 } and define the function fP/œÉ:‚Ñùn‚Üí‚Ñù:subscriptùëìùëÉùúé‚Üísuperscript‚Ñùùëõ‚Ñùf_{P/\sigma}\colon\mathbb{R}^{n}\to\mathbb{R}italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P / italic_œÉ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT : blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Üí blackboard_R by fP/œÉ‚Å¢(x)=‚ü®eP/œÉ,x‚ü©+bP/œÉsubscriptùëìùëÉùúéùë•subscriptùëíùëÉùúéùë•subscriptùëèùëÉùúéf_{P/\sigma}(x)=\langle e_{P/\sigma},x\rangle+b_{P/\sigma}italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P / italic_œÉ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x ) = ‚ü® italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P / italic_œÉ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_x ‚ü© + italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P / italic_œÉ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Since ùí´ùí´\mathcal{P}caligraphic_P is complete, the graph G=(V,E)ùê∫ùëâùê∏G=(V,E)italic_G = ( italic_V , italic_E ) given by V={1,‚Ä¶,k}ùëâ1‚Ä¶ùëòV=\{1,\ldots,k\}italic_V = { 1 , ‚Ä¶ , italic_k } and E={{i,j}‚à£Pj‚à©Pi‚ààùí´n‚àí1}ùê∏conditional-setùëñùëósubscriptùëÉùëósubscriptùëÉùëñsuperscriptùí´ùëõ1E=\{\{i,j\}\mid P_{j}\cap P_{i}\in\mathcal{P}^{n-1}\}italic_E = { { italic_i , italic_j } ‚à£ italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚à© italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àà caligraphic_P start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT } is connected. Start by defining the function f|P1=0evaluated-atùëìsubscriptùëÉ10f|_{P_{1}}=0italic_f | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = 0. For 1<i‚â§k1ùëñùëò1<i\leq k1 < italic_i ‚â§ italic_k, let (j1,‚Ä¶‚Å¢jm)subscriptùëó1‚Ä¶subscriptùëóùëö(j_{1},\ldots j_{m})( italic_j start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ‚Ä¶ italic_j start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) be a path from 1111 to iùëñiitalic_i and for ‚Ñì‚àà[m‚àí1]‚Ñìdelimited-[]ùëö1\ell\in[m-1]roman_‚Ñì ‚àà [ italic_m - 1 ], let œÉ‚Ñì=Pj‚Ñì‚à©Pj‚Ñì+1subscriptùúé‚ÑìsubscriptùëÉsubscriptùëó‚ÑìsubscriptùëÉsubscriptùëó‚Ñì1\sigma_{\ell}=P_{j_{\ell}}\cap P_{j_{\ell+1}}italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_‚Ñì end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_‚Ñì end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚à© italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_‚Ñì + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and define the function

f|Pi=‚àë‚Ñì=1m‚àí1w‚Å¢(œÉ‚Ñì)‚ãÖfPj‚Ñì/œÉ‚Ñì.evaluated-atùëìsubscriptùëÉùëñsuperscriptsubscript‚Ñì1ùëö1‚ãÖùë§subscriptùúé‚ÑìsubscriptùëìsubscriptùëÉsubscriptùëó‚Ñìsubscriptùúé‚Ñìf|_{P_{i}}=\sum_{\ell=1}^{m-1}w(\sigma_{\ell})\cdot f_{P_{j_{\ell}}/\sigma_{% \ell}}.italic_f | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_‚Ñì = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_m - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_w ( italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_‚Ñì end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ‚ãÖ italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_‚Ñì end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_‚Ñì end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT .

First, we argue that f|Pievaluated-atùëìsubscriptùëÉùëñf|_{P_{i}}italic_f | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is well-defined, that is, the definition of f|Pievaluated-atùëìsubscriptùëÉùëñf|_{P_{i}}italic_f | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT does not depend on the path from vertex 1111 to iùëñiitalic_i. Equivalently, it suffices to show that for any cycle (i1,‚Ä¶,im)subscriptùëñ1‚Ä¶subscriptùëñùëö(i_{1},\ldots,i_{m})( italic_i start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ‚Ä¶ , italic_i start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) in Gùê∫Gitalic_G with i1=imsubscriptùëñ1subscriptùëñùëöi_{1}=i_{m}italic_i start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_i start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, it holds that ‚àë‚Ñì=1m‚àí1w‚Å¢(œÉ‚Ñì)‚Å¢fPi‚Ñì/œÉ‚Ñì=0superscriptsubscript‚Ñì1ùëö1ùë§subscriptùúé‚ÑìsubscriptùëìsubscriptùëÉsubscriptùëñ‚Ñìsubscriptùúé‚Ñì0\sum_{\ell=1}^{m-1}w(\sigma_{\ell})f_{{P_{i_{\ell}}/\sigma_{\ell}}}=0‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_‚Ñì = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_m - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_w ( italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_‚Ñì end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_‚Ñì end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_‚Ñì end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = 0, where œÉ‚Ñì=Pi‚Ñì‚à©Pi‚Ñì+1subscriptùúé‚ÑìsubscriptùëÉsubscriptùëñ‚ÑìsubscriptùëÉsubscriptùëñ‚Ñì1\sigma_{\ell}=P_{i_{\ell}}\cap P_{i_{\ell+1}}italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_‚Ñì end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_‚Ñì end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚à© italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_‚Ñì + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Since ùí´ùí´\mathcal{P}caligraphic_P is complete any cycle decomposes into cycles (i1,‚Ä¶,im)subscriptùëñ1‚Ä¶subscriptùëñùëö(i_{1},\ldots,i_{m})( italic_i start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ‚Ä¶ , italic_i start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) corresponding to the star of a cone œÑ‚ààùí´n‚àí2ùúèsuperscriptùí´ùëõ2\tau\in\mathcal{P}^{n-2}italic_œÑ ‚àà caligraphic_P start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n - 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, that is, {œÉ1,‚Ä¶,œÉm‚àí1}={œÉ‚ààùí´n‚àí1‚à£œÉ‚äÉœÑ}subscriptùúé1‚Ä¶subscriptùúéùëö1conditional-setùúésuperscriptùí´ùëõ1ùúèùúé\{\sigma_{1},\ldots,\sigma_{m-1}\}=\{\sigma\in\mathcal{P}^{n-1}\mid\sigma% \supset\tau\}{ italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ‚Ä¶ , italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } = { italic_œÉ ‚àà caligraphic_P start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚à£ italic_œÉ ‚äÉ italic_œÑ }. Since TœÑsubscriptùëáùúèT_{\tau}italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÑ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is an automorphism, it holds that ‚àë‚Ñì=1m‚àí1w‚Å¢(œÉ‚Ñì)‚ãÖeœÉ‚Ñì/œÑ=0superscriptsubscript‚Ñì1ùëö1‚ãÖùë§subscriptùúé‚Ñìsubscriptùëísubscriptùúé‚Ñìùúè0\sum_{\ell=1}^{m-1}w(\sigma_{\ell})\cdot e_{\sigma_{\ell}/\tau}=0‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_‚Ñì = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_m - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_w ( italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_‚Ñì end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ‚ãÖ italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_‚Ñì end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_œÑ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = 0 if and only if ‚àë‚Ñì=1m‚àí1w‚Å¢(œÉ‚Ñì)‚ãÖePi‚Ñì/œÉ‚Ñì=0superscriptsubscript‚Ñì1ùëö1‚ãÖùë§subscriptùúé‚ÑìsubscriptùëísubscriptùëÉsubscriptùëñ‚Ñìsubscriptùúé‚Ñì0\sum_{\ell=1}^{m-1}w(\sigma_{\ell})\cdot e_{P_{i_{\ell}}/\sigma_{\ell}}=0‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_‚Ñì = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_m - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_w ( italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_‚Ñì end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ‚ãÖ italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_‚Ñì end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_‚Ñì end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = 0

So, let x‚àà‚Ñùnùë•superscript‚Ñùùëõx\in\mathbb{R}^{n}italic_x ‚àà blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT be arbitrary and x‚Ä≤‚ààaff‚Å°(œÑ)superscriptùë•‚Ä≤affùúèx^{\prime}\in\operatorname{aff}(\tau)italic_x start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àà roman_aff ( italic_œÑ ) and x‚Ä≤‚Ä≤‚ààaff(œÑ)‚üÇx^{\prime\prime}\in\operatorname{aff}(\tau)^{\perp}italic_x start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àà roman_aff ( italic_œÑ ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚üÇ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT such that x=x‚Ä≤+x‚Ä≤‚Ä≤ùë•superscriptùë•‚Ä≤superscriptùë•‚Ä≤‚Ä≤x=x^{\prime}+x^{\prime\prime}italic_x = italic_x start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_x start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. Since wùë§witalic_w is in ùí≤ùí´subscriptùí≤ùí´\mathcal{W}_{\mathcal{P}}caligraphic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, it holds that ‚àëœÉ‚äÉœÑœÉ‚ààùí´n‚àí1w‚Å¢(œÉ)‚ãÖeœÉ/œÑ=0subscriptùúèùúéùúésuperscriptùí´ùëõ1‚ãÖùë§ùúésubscriptùëíùúéùúè0\sum\limits_{\begin{subarray}{c}\sigma\supset\tau\\ \sigma\in\mathcal{P}^{n-1}\end{subarray}}w(\sigma)\cdot e_{\sigma/\tau}=0‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_ARG start_ROW start_CELL italic_œÉ ‚äÉ italic_œÑ end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL italic_œÉ ‚àà caligraphic_P start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_CELL end_ROW end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w ( italic_œÉ ) ‚ãÖ italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÉ / italic_œÑ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = 0 and hence it follows that

‚àë‚Ñì=1m‚àí1w‚Å¢(œÉ‚Ñì)‚Å¢fPi‚Ñì/œÉ‚Ñì‚Å¢(x)superscriptsubscript‚Ñì1ùëö1ùë§subscriptùúé‚ÑìsubscriptùëìsubscriptùëÉsubscriptùëñ‚Ñìsubscriptùúé‚Ñìùë•\displaystyle\sum_{\ell=1}^{m-1}w(\sigma_{\ell})f_{{P_{i_{\ell}}/\sigma_{\ell}% }}(x)‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_‚Ñì = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_m - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_w ( italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_‚Ñì end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_‚Ñì end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_‚Ñì end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x ) =‚àë‚Ñì=1m‚àí1w‚Å¢(œÉ‚Ñì)‚ãÖ‚ü®ePi‚Ñì/œÉ‚Ñì,x‚Ä≤+x‚Ä≤‚Ä≤‚ü©+bPi‚Ñì/œÉ‚Ñìabsentsuperscriptsubscript‚Ñì1ùëö1‚ãÖùë§subscriptùúé‚ÑìsubscriptùëísubscriptùëÉsubscriptùëñ‚Ñìsubscriptùúé‚Ñìsuperscriptùë•‚Ä≤superscriptùë•‚Ä≤‚Ä≤subscriptùëèsubscriptùëÉsubscriptùëñ‚Ñìsubscriptùúé‚Ñì\displaystyle=\sum_{\ell=1}^{m-1}w(\sigma_{\ell})\cdot\langle e_{P_{i_{\ell}}/% \sigma_{\ell}},x^{\prime}+x^{\prime\prime}\rangle+b_{P_{i_{\ell}}/\sigma_{\ell}}= ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_‚Ñì = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_m - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_w ( italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_‚Ñì end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ‚ãÖ ‚ü® italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_‚Ñì end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_‚Ñì end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_x start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_x start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚ü© + italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_‚Ñì end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_‚Ñì end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT
=‚àë‚Ñì=1m‚àí1w‚Å¢(œÉ‚Ñì)‚ãÖ‚ü®ePi‚Ñì/œÉ‚Ñì,x‚Ä≤‚Ä≤‚ü©absentsuperscriptsubscript‚Ñì1ùëö1‚ãÖùë§subscriptùúé‚ÑìsubscriptùëísubscriptùëÉsubscriptùëñ‚Ñìsubscriptùúé‚Ñìsuperscriptùë•‚Ä≤‚Ä≤\displaystyle=\sum_{\ell=1}^{m-1}w(\sigma_{\ell})\cdot\langle e_{P_{i_{\ell}}/% \sigma_{\ell}},x^{\prime\prime}\rangle= ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_‚Ñì = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_m - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_w ( italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_‚Ñì end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ‚ãÖ ‚ü® italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_‚Ñì end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_‚Ñì end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_x start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚ü©
=‚ü®‚àë‚Ñì=1m‚àí1w‚Å¢(œÉ‚Ñì)‚ãÖePi‚Ñì/œÉ‚Ñì,x‚Ä≤‚Ä≤‚ü©absentdelimited-‚ü®‚ü©superscriptsubscript‚Ñì1ùëö1‚ãÖùë§subscriptùúé‚ÑìsubscriptùëísubscriptùëÉsubscriptùëñ‚Ñìsubscriptùúé‚Ñìsuperscriptùë•‚Ä≤‚Ä≤\displaystyle=\langle\sum_{\ell=1}^{m-1}w(\sigma_{\ell})\cdot e_{P_{i_{\ell}}/% \sigma_{\ell},x^{\prime\prime}}\rangle= ‚ü® ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_‚Ñì = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_m - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_w ( italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_‚Ñì end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ‚ãÖ italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_‚Ñì end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_œÉ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_‚Ñì end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_x start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ü©
=0absent0\displaystyle=0= 0

By definition, fùëìfitalic_f is a CPWL function and compatible with ùí´ùí´\mathcal{P}caligraphic_P and hence in ùí±ùí´subscriptùí±ùí´\mathcal{V}_{\mathcal{P}}caligraphic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. To see that w=œï‚Å¢(f)ùë§italic-œïùëìw=\phi(f)italic_w = italic_œï ( italic_f ), let P,Q‚ààùí´nùëÉùëÑsuperscriptùí´ùëõP,Q\in\mathcal{P}^{n}italic_P , italic_Q ‚àà caligraphic_P start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT such that œÉ=P‚à©Q‚ààùí´n‚àí1ùúéùëÉùëÑsuperscriptùí´ùëõ1\sigma=P\cap Q\in\mathcal{P}^{n-1}italic_œÉ = italic_P ‚à© italic_Q ‚àà caligraphic_P start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. Then it holds that aP‚àíaQ=w‚Å¢(œÉ)‚ãÖeP/œÉsubscriptùëéùëÉsubscriptùëéùëÑ‚ãÖùë§ùúésubscriptùëíùëÉùúéa_{P}-a_{Q}=w(\sigma)\cdot e_{P/\sigma}italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_w ( italic_œÉ ) ‚ãÖ italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P / italic_œÉ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and hence

wf‚Å¢(œÉ)=‚ü®eP/œÉ,aP‚ü©+‚ü®eQ/œÉ,aQ‚ü©=‚ü®eP/œÉ,aP‚àíaQ‚ü©=‚ü®eP/œÉ,w‚Å¢(œÉ)‚ãÖeP/œÉ‚ü©=w‚Å¢(œÉ),subscriptùë§ùëìùúésubscriptùëíùëÉùúésubscriptùëéùëÉsubscriptùëíùëÑùúésubscriptùëéùëÑsubscriptùëíùëÉùúésubscriptùëéùëÉsubscriptùëéùëÑsubscriptùëíùëÉùúé‚ãÖùë§ùúésubscriptùëíùëÉùúéùë§ùúéw_{f}(\sigma)=\langle e_{P/\sigma},a_{P}\rangle+\langle e_{Q/\sigma},a_{Q}% \rangle=\langle e_{P/\sigma},a_{P}-a_{Q}\rangle=\langle e_{P/\sigma},w(\sigma)% \cdot e_{P/\sigma}\rangle=w(\sigma),italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_œÉ ) = ‚ü® italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P / italic_œÉ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ü© + ‚ü® italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q / italic_œÉ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ü© = ‚ü® italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P / italic_œÉ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ü© = ‚ü® italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P / italic_œÉ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_w ( italic_œÉ ) ‚ãÖ italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P / italic_œÉ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ü© = italic_w ( italic_œÉ ) ,

finishing the proof. ‚àé

E.3 Corollary E.1

Corollary E.1.

ùí±ùí´subscriptùí±ùí´\mathcal{V}_{\mathcal{P}}caligraphic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is finite-dimensional.

Proof.

By Lemma 3.2, we have that ùí±¬Øùí´=ùí±ùí´/Aff‚Å°(‚Ñùn)‚âÖùí≤ùí´subscript¬Øùí±ùí´subscriptùí±ùí´Affsuperscript‚Ñùùëõsubscriptùí≤ùí´\overline{\mathcal{V}}_{\mathcal{P}}=\mathcal{V}_{\mathcal{P}}/\operatorname{% Aff}(\mathbb{R}^{n})\cong\mathcal{W}_{\mathcal{P}}over¬Ø start_ARG caligraphic_V end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = caligraphic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / roman_Aff ( blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ‚âÖ caligraphic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Thus, the dimension of ùí±ùí´subscriptùí±ùí´\mathcal{V}_{\mathcal{P}}caligraphic_V start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is bounded from above by dim(ùí≤ùí´)+dim(Aff‚Å°(‚Ñùn))‚â§|ùí´n‚àí1|+(n+1)dimensionsubscriptùí≤ùí´dimensionAffsuperscript‚Ñùùëõsuperscriptùí´ùëõ1ùëõ1\dim(\mathcal{W}_{\mathcal{P}})+\dim(\operatorname{Aff}(\mathbb{R}^{n}))\leq% \lvert\mathcal{P}^{n-1}\rvert+(n+1)roman_dim ( caligraphic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + roman_dim ( roman_Aff ( blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) ‚â§ | caligraphic_P start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | + ( italic_n + 1 ). ‚àé

E.4 Proof of Proposition 3.3

Proof.

The function fùëìfitalic_f is convex if and only if it is locally convex around any œÉ‚ààùí´n‚àí1ùúésuperscriptùí´ùëõ1\sigma\in\mathcal{P}^{n-1}italic_œÉ ‚àà caligraphic_P start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, that is, fùëìfitalic_f is locally convex around every xùë•xitalic_x in the relative interior of œÉùúé\sigmaitalic_œÉ. For any such xùë•xitalic_x, there is a Œª>0ùúÜ0\lambda>0italic_Œª > 0 such that x+Œª‚ãÖeP/œÉ‚ààPùë•‚ãÖùúÜsubscriptùëíùëÉùúéùëÉx+\lambda\cdot e_{P/\sigma}\in Pitalic_x + italic_Œª ‚ãÖ italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P / italic_œÉ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àà italic_P and x+Œª‚ãÖeQ/œÉ‚ààQùë•‚ãÖùúÜsubscriptùëíùëÑùúéùëÑx+\lambda\cdot e_{Q/\sigma}\in Qitalic_x + italic_Œª ‚ãÖ italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q / italic_œÉ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àà italic_Q, by construction of eP/œÉsubscriptùëíùëÉùúée_{P/\sigma}italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P / italic_œÉ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and eQ/œÉsubscriptùëíùëÑùúée_{Q/\sigma}italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q / italic_œÉ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Recall from the proof of Lemma 3.2 that wf‚Å¢(œÉ)=‚ü®eP/œÉ,aP‚ü©+‚ü®eQ/œÉ,aQ‚ü©subscriptùë§ùëìùúésubscriptùëíùëÉùúésubscriptùëéùëÉsubscriptùëíùëÑùúésubscriptùëéùëÑw_{f}(\sigma)=\langle e_{P/\sigma},a_{P}\rangle+\langle e_{Q/\sigma},a_{Q}\rangleitalic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_œÉ ) = ‚ü® italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P / italic_œÉ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ü© + ‚ü® italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q / italic_œÉ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ü©, where f|P‚Å¢(x)=‚ü®aP,x‚ü©+bPevaluated-atùëìùëÉùë•subscriptùëéùëÉùë•subscriptùëèùëÉf|_{P}(x)=\langle a_{P},x\rangle+b_{P}italic_f | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x ) = ‚ü® italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_x ‚ü© + italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and f|Q‚Å¢(x)=‚ü®aQ,x‚ü©+bQevaluated-atùëìùëÑùë•subscriptùëéùëÑùë•subscriptùëèùëÑf|_{Q}(x)=\langle a_{Q},x\rangle+b_{Q}italic_f | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x ) = ‚ü® italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_x ‚ü© + italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Since P,Q‚ààùí´nùëÉùëÑsuperscriptùí´ùëõP,Q\in\mathcal{P}^{n}italic_P , italic_Q ‚àà caligraphic_P start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and ‚ÄñeP/œÉ‚Äñ=‚ÄñeQ/œÉ‚Äñ=1normsubscriptùëíùëÉùúénormsubscriptùëíùëÑùúé1\|e_{P/\sigma}\|=\|e_{Q/\sigma}\|=1‚à• italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P / italic_œÉ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚à• = ‚à• italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q / italic_œÉ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚à• = 1, we have that xùë•xitalic_x is the midpoint of x+Œª‚ãÖeP/œÉùë•‚ãÖùúÜsubscriptùëíùëÉùúéx+\lambda\cdot e_{P/\sigma}italic_x + italic_Œª ‚ãÖ italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P / italic_œÉ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and x+Œª‚ãÖeQ/œÉùë•‚ãÖùúÜsubscriptùëíùëÑùúéx+\lambda\cdot e_{Q/\sigma}italic_x + italic_Œª ‚ãÖ italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q / italic_œÉ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Therefore, fùëìfitalic_f is convex if and only if f‚Å¢(x)‚â§12‚Å¢f‚Å¢(x+Œª‚ãÖeP/œÉ)+12‚Å¢f‚Å¢(x+Œª‚ãÖeQ/œÉ)ùëìùë•12ùëìùë•‚ãÖùúÜsubscriptùëíùëÉùúé12ùëìùë•‚ãÖùúÜsubscriptùëíùëÑùúéf(x)\leq\frac{1}{2}f(x+\lambda\cdot e_{P/\sigma})+\frac{1}{2}f(x+\lambda\cdot e% _{Q/\sigma})italic_f ( italic_x ) ‚â§ divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG italic_f ( italic_x + italic_Œª ‚ãÖ italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P / italic_œÉ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG italic_f ( italic_x + italic_Œª ‚ãÖ italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q / italic_œÉ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ). Equivalently,

0‚â§f‚Å¢(x+Œª‚ãÖeP/œÉ)+f‚Å¢(x+Œª‚ãÖeQ/œÉ)‚àí2‚Å¢f‚Å¢(x)=Œª‚Å¢(‚ü®eP/œÉ,aP‚ü©+‚ü®eQ/œÉ,aQ‚ü©)=Œª‚ãÖwf‚Å¢(œÉ).0ùëìùë•‚ãÖùúÜsubscriptùëíùëÉùúéùëìùë•‚ãÖùúÜsubscriptùëíùëÑùúé2ùëìùë•ùúÜsubscriptùëíùëÉùúésubscriptùëéùëÉsubscriptùëíùëÑùúésubscriptùëéùëÑ‚ãÖùúÜsubscriptùë§ùëìùúé0\leq f(x+\lambda\cdot e_{P/\sigma})+f(x+\lambda\cdot e_{Q/\sigma})-2f(x)=% \lambda(\langle e_{P/\sigma},a_{P}\rangle+\langle e_{Q/\sigma},a_{Q}\rangle)=% \lambda\cdot w_{f}(\sigma).0 ‚â§ italic_f ( italic_x + italic_Œª ‚ãÖ italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P / italic_œÉ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + italic_f ( italic_x + italic_Œª ‚ãÖ italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q / italic_œÉ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - 2 italic_f ( italic_x ) = italic_Œª ( ‚ü® italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P / italic_œÉ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ü© + ‚ü® italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q / italic_œÉ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚ü© ) = italic_Œª ‚ãÖ italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_œÉ ) .

If ùí´=ùí´fùí´subscriptùí´ùëì\mathcal{P}=\mathcal{P}_{f}caligraphic_P = caligraphic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, then we have strict local convexity at every œÉ‚ààùí´n‚àí1ùúésuperscriptùí´ùëõ1\sigma\in\mathcal{P}^{n-1}italic_œÉ ‚àà caligraphic_P start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, which means a strict inequality in the inequality above. ‚àé

E.5 Lemma E.2

Lemma E.2.

ùí±¬Øùí´+superscriptsubscript¬Øùí±ùí´\overline{\mathcal{V}}_{\mathcal{P}}^{+}over¬Ø start_ARG caligraphic_V end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT forms a polyhedral cone in ùí±¬Øùí´subscript¬Øùí±ùí´\overline{\mathcal{V}}_{\mathcal{P}}over¬Ø start_ARG caligraphic_V end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT.

Proof.

Lemma 3.2 and Proposition 3.3 imply that the set of convex functions in ùí±¬Øùí´subscript¬Øùí±ùí´\overline{\mathcal{V}}_{\mathcal{P}}over¬Ø start_ARG caligraphic_V end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT satisfies ùí±¬Øùí´+‚âÖùí≤ùí´+‚âî‚ãÇœÉ‚ààùí´n‚àí1{w‚ààùí≤ùí´‚à£w‚Å¢(œÉ)‚â•0}superscriptsubscript¬Øùí±ùí´superscriptsubscriptùí≤ùí´‚âîsubscriptùúésuperscriptùí´ùëõ1conditional-setùë§subscriptùí≤ùí´ùë§ùúé0\overline{\mathcal{V}}_{\mathcal{P}}^{+}\cong\mathcal{W}_{\mathcal{P}}^{+}% \coloneqq\bigcap_{\sigma\in\mathcal{P}^{n-1}}\{w\in\mathcal{W}_{\mathcal{P}}% \mid w(\sigma)\geq 0\}over¬Ø start_ARG caligraphic_V end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚âÖ caligraphic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚âî ‚ãÇ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œÉ ‚àà caligraphic_P start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT { italic_w ‚àà caligraphic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚à£ italic_w ( italic_œÉ ) ‚â• 0 }. This is a finite intersection of linear inequalities, so ùí≤ùí´+superscriptsubscriptùí≤ùí´\mathcal{W}_{\mathcal{P}}^{+}caligraphic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is a polyhedral cone. Moreover, ‚Äú‚âÖ\cong‚âÖ‚Äù is a linear isomorphism, which implies that ùí±¬Øùí´+superscriptsubscript¬Øùí±ùí´\overline{\mathcal{V}}_{\mathcal{P}}^{+}over¬Ø start_ARG caligraphic_V end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is a polyhedral cone. ‚àé

E.6 Lemma E.3

Lemma E.3.

Let ùí´ùí´\mathcal{P}caligraphic_P be a regular polyhredral complex. Then every CPWL function compatible with ùí´ùí´\mathcal{P}caligraphic_P can be written as a difference of two convex CPWL functions that are also compatible with ùí´ùí´\mathcal{P}caligraphic_P.
